title: brainwasher_detective
body:
Brainwashing-Detective (洗脳探偵, Sen'nō Tantei?) is a parody design of [[Hisui (tsukihime)|]] detailed in Character Material. She has not made any appearances in main works, but she has a brief role in a segment of [[Carnival Phantasm]]. This tag is for the character, for posts of the Hisui brainwashing meme (Which she's based on so there's overlap between the 2 naturally) use [[anata wo hannin desu]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #1761294

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Brainwashing-Detective":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Brainwashing-Detective
other_names: ロックドルーム・ディティクティブ

title: hoshimachi_suisei
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who originally started as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] before joining [[hololive]]'s music label [i]INNK Music[/i]. She would later transfer to hololive proper and become part of hololive's "[[0th Generation (hololive)|Generation 0]]".

Her appearance was designed by herself, as well as the costumes from her indie days. She got a new design from [[Teshima Nari]] after joining hololive, with her newer costumes being designed by [[Saekiyahiro]].

She has [[blue eyes]] with [[star in eye|stars]] in them and [[blue hair|blue]] [[medium hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] hanging [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side ponytail]] held with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]].

body:
[[Vector (girls' frontline 2)|]]'s second skin from [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], releasing in the Outfit Boutique in 2025.

It's a modular skin, that, in addition to the main schoolgirl skin set, contains interchangeable elements based on her appearances in [[Girls' Frontline]], specifically her [[vector (girls' frontline)|Default]] (Set 2) and her [[vector (kitty paws) (girls' frontline)|Kitty Paws]] skin (Set 3).

title: amate_yuzuriha
body:
Female protagonist of [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]], better known by her nickname, "Machu." She is also the second female protagonist of a [[Gundam]] TV anime, succeeding [[Suletta Mercury]] from [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]].

Her voice actress is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

Amate's character design is similar to [[Elpeo Puru]] and [[Puru Two]] from [[Gundam ZZ]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #24046367: [[school uniform|High school uniform]]
* !asset #24046368: [[Mecha pilot suit]]

title: char_aznable
body:
The main antagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and the eponymous [[Char's Counterattack]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival and foe of [[Amuro Ray]]. Also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]].

[b]Char Aznable[/b], also known as [b]The Red Comet[/b] by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [spoilers](as he was able to destroy 5 Federation battleships with a simple red colored [[Zaku I]] in quick succession during the "Battle of Loum":https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/Battle_of_Loum)[/spoilers]), is originally a blonde-haired [[Zeon]] ace pilot of the [[Zaku II S Char Custom|MS-06S Zaku II Commander Type]], [[z'gok char custom|Z'Gok]], [[gelgoog s char custom|Gelgoog]], [[Zeong|MSN-02 Zeong]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Gundam Mk II]], [[Zero Shiki (gundam)|]], [[Hyaku Shiki|MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki]] and the [[Neo Zeon]] [[Char's Dijeh]], [[Dijeh Traversia]], [[Geara Doga Psycommu Test Type]] and the [[Sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]]/[[nightingale (gundam)|MSN-04II Nightingale]]. 

He is usually depicted with some sort of eyewear or headwear (usually [[sunglasses]] or his trademark [[helmet]]), concealing his eyes.

[spoilers]His real name is [b][[Casval Rem Deikun]][/b] and he has [[blue eyes]]. He stole the identity of [[char aznable (real)|the real Char Aznable]]  (who is mostly identical to him except his brown eyes) to avoid being killed by [[Kycilia Zabi]] as a part of her plan to purge the Deikun family, and as such he chose to conceal his eyes to hide his real identity. He is the actual brother of [[Sayla Mass]]/[[Artesia Som Deikun]] and the true heir to Zeon.[/spoilers]

Char's name was inspired by the real life Franco-Armenian singer and actor "Charles Aznavour":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Aznavour. In [[Japan]] Char is as well known and popular as iconic characters [[Darth Vader]] and [[spock|Mr. Spock]] are in the West. 

He is voiced by [[Ikeda Shuuichi]].

h4. Char's women

* [[Lalah Sune]]
* [[Reccoa Londe]]
* [[Nanai Miguel]]
* [[Quess Paraya]]

h4. See also

* [spoilers][[Char Aznable (real)]][/spoilers]
* [spoilers][[Quattro Bajeena]][/spoilers]
* [spoilers][[Full Frontal]][/spoilers]

title: amuro_ray
body:
Main protagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and [[Char's Counterattack]]/[[Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival of [[Char Aznable]]. 

[b]Amuro Ray[/b], also known as [b]The White Devil[/b] by [[Zeon]] forces, is the young brown-haired pilot of the [[Earth Federation]] [[rx-78-2 gundam|RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], the [[aeug|Karaba]] [[Dijeh]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Zeta Gundam 3A Type]], [[Zeta Plus A1 (Amuro Colors)]] and the [[earth federation space forces|Londo Bell]] [[Rick Dijeh Kai]], [[Re-GZ]], [[nu gundam|RX-93 Nu Gundam]]/[[hi-nu gundam|RX-93-ν2 Hi-Nu Gundam]].

Son of [[Tem Ray]] and [[Kamaria Ray]].

In [[real life]] he is voiced by [[Furuya Tooru]].

h4. Amuro's Women

* [[Fraw Bow]]
* [[Matilda Ajan]]
* [[Lalah Sune]]
* [[Beltorchika Irma]]
* [[Chan Agi]]

title: sandman_(sbr)
body:
Sandman, [spoilers]real name Soundman (サウンドマン, Saundoman) [/spoilers], is a secondary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].

His Stand is [[In a Silent Way (stand)|]].

Sandman is a man of athletic build. He wears his [[two-tone hair]] in  [[twin braids]] crossing his face. He is sparsely clothed, with a few [[tattoo|tattoos]] around his body. On both side of his biceps is a [[tattoo]] of a slithering [[snake]] inside a circle, lined with triangles pointing inward, while on his right chest are three lines that resemble check marks. He wears a  [[pelvic curtain]].
 
Namesake is the  Metallica song "Enter the Sandman"

title: ringo_roadagain
body:
Ringo Roadagain is a secondary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
Ringo is a man average build. He has light hair passing his forehead, swept to his left; a [[long mustache|long]], [[thick mustache]], a [[soul patch]] in the shape of a cartoonish [[skull]], and a [[beard]] of two slim patches bordering his chin.
He wears a light [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[jacket]] with a high [[popped collar]], dark [[gloves]] revealing his thumbs and index fingers, and a [[wristwatch]] of a fine, modern design on his right. It's shown that his pants are lightly frilled and studded near the bottom of the legs.
As a gunman, Ringo also wields a [[revolver]] (1874 Colt) with an assorted [[ammunition belt]] and [[holster]].

He's a [[stand (jojo)|]] user and his [[stand (jojo)|]] is [[Mandom (stand)|]].

Namesake:
Ringo Starr (Former The Beatles drummer)
On the Road Again (Willie Nelson song).
other_names: リンゴォ・ロードアゲイン

title: miyamoto_musashi
body:
[b]Miyamoto Musashi[/b] is a famous [[samurai]] from the Sengoku era of Japan. He is reputed to be the best swordsman in the history of Japan, with 62 recorded victories in a sword duel, and has never been defeated once. He is known for being capable of killing a man at just 13 years old and his unique [[dual wielding]] swords technique.

h4. Characters named/based on Musashi
* [[Miyamoto Musashi (Baki)]]
* [[Miyamoto Musashi (Fate)]]
* [[Miyamoto Musashi (Gundou Musashi)]]
* [[Miyamoto Musashi (Souken no Cross Age)]]
* [[Musashi (Musashiden)]]

title: miyamoto_musashi_(fate)
body:
Saber-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She's a genderswap of the famous samurai of the [[Miyamoto Musashi|same name]] who killed his first man in a duel at age 13,  founded the Niten Ichi-ryū (二天一流) style of swordsmanship and wrote The Book of Five Rings (五輪の書).

She has [[pink hair]] in a [[ponytail]] held by a fan-like [[hair ornament]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Initially wears a [[blue kimono|blue]] [[sleeveless kimono]] with an [[obi]], black [[detached sleeves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[sandals]]. Later her kimono becomes more elaborate, gaining a [[navel cutout]], a red cloth with a [[maple leaf print]], and more red details. The chest area is also revealed. Sometimes her sleeves are also [[wide sleeves|widened]]. She has maple [[earrings]] and [[dual wielding|wields two]] [[katana|katanas]] while keeping two more [[sheathed]] at her waist.

[b]Illustrator[/b]: [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Sakura Ayane]]

title: mirage_2000
body:
A single-engined delta wing [[jet]] fighter manufactured by the French company Dassault Aviation. To distinguish it from other similar-looking [[airplane|airplanes]] from the same company, look for small strakes just behind the engine inlets. Internal armament is two 30mm [[cannon]]; payload can include various rockets, missiles, and bombs.

title: dungeon_ni_deai_wo_motomeru_no_wa_machigatteiru_darou_ka
body:
[b]Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka?[/b] (lit. [i]Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?[/i], abbrev. [i]DanMachi[/i]) is a Japanese light novel series, written by Fujino Oomori and illustrated by [[Yasuda Suzuhito]].

SB Creative has published six volumes since January 2013 under their GA Bunko imprint. It has received a spin-off light novel series and three manga adaptations. An anime television series adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]] that started airing on April 3rd, 2015.

title: esil_radiru
body: A supporting character from the South Korean multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. She's a demon noble and a princess of the Radiru clan. Esil was voluntold by [[Sung Jin-Woo]] to be his guide through a demon castle of a hundred levels, and helped him defeat the demon king Baran on the 100th level of said castle.

title: carl_wheezer
body: Carlton "Carl" Ulysses Wheezer is a fictional character from the American computer animated film [[jimmy neutron (series)|Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius]] and its adapted television series The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius created by John A. Davis. He is obsessed with llamas. He has a high-pitched voice. He is one of Jimmy’s best friends.

title: rocko's_modern_life
body: Rocko's Modern Life is an American comedy animated television series created by Joe Murray for [[Nickelodeon]]. The series centers on the surreal life of an anthropomorphic Australian immigrant [[wallaby]] named Rocko and his friends: the eccentric steer [[Heffer Wolfe]], the neurotic turtle Filburt, and Rocko's faithful dog Spunky. It is set in the fictional town of O-Town. Throughout its run to present day, the series has been controversial for its adult humor, including double entendre, innuendo, and satirical social commentary, and gained a cult following, similar to [[ren & stimpy|The Ren & Stimpy Show]].
other_names: ロッコーのモダンライフ

title: krumm
body: Krumm, a strange, hairy flesh-colored [[monster]] with free-rolling eyes that he normally carries around in his hands. Smells horrible, and reveled in it: "I love being smelly." A happy-go-lucky Big Eater who doesn't stress about scaring as much as his friends.

title: oblina
body: Oblina, who resembles a black-and-white [[candy cane]] with big red lips and eye stalks. Can pull her insides out at will; naturally, this makes her the best at scaring, and she is considered the Gromble's best student. Comes from a rich family, and has a strange accent. Often fights with [[Ickis]] over his bad habits.

title: ickis
body: Ickis, a little purple monster who often gets mistaken for a [[bunny]], much to his dismay. Can grow to impressive sizes, but isn’t very good at controlling this change at the start of the series, and frequently struggles with his scares. Tended to be both arrogant and very insecure, due in no small part to trying to live up to his famous father's reputation. Despite his bumbling and trouble-prone nature, also saves the day more than once.

title: aaahh!!!_real_monsters
body: Aaahh!!! Real Monsters is an American animated television series developed by Klasky Csupo for [[Nickelodeon]]. It is the fifth Nicktoon after Doug, [[Rugrats]], [[ren & stimpy|The Ren & Stimpy Show]] and [[Rocko's Modern Life]]. The show focuses on three young monsters—[[Ickis]], [[Oblina]], and [[Krumm]]—who attend a school for monsters under a city dump and learn to frighten humans. Many of the episodes revolve around their zany hijinks after making it to the surface in order to perform "scares" as class assignments. The series premiered on October 29, 1994 and aired until November 16, 1997.

[b]Admiral Akainu[/b] (real name: [b]Sakazuki[/b]) is a Marine admiral in the world of [[One Piece]], being one of the series' main antagonists.

Having consumed the Magu Magu no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has the power to turn into and control magma.

[spoiler]Promoted to Fleet Admiral after the war against [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard]]. He fought against [[Kuzan (Aokiji)|Aokiji]] for ten days straight at Punk Hazard before emerging victorious.[/spoiler]

title: cirno
body:
"The Small Ice Fairy"

Debuted as the Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[ice wings]], and wears a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She appears in [[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]] as a playable character, "[[Tanned Cirno]]."

An ice fairy living in the [[Misty Lake]], near the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]. A relatively weak fighter, but nevertheless claims to be the strongest of all (somewhat justified, as fairies are low-tier generic enemies in the series). One of her hobbies is [[frozen|freezing]] [[frog|frogs]] and watching them thaw (a third of which ends up shattering), leading doujins to portray her at odds with the frog-themed goddess [[Moriya Suwako]].

Her large ego and childish incompetence earned her the nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]" (pronounced "maru kyuu"/"nine-ball"), based on an "elements of play" screenshot from the game manual of [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] in which she was labelled 「9.バカ」 ("baka"/"idiot"). Another contributing factor to her portrayal as an idiot is her [[Icicle Fall]] spell card from Embodiment of Scarlet Devil, which (on Easy difficulty only) fails to hit a "safe zone" directly beneath/in front of her. Doujins also portray her as de facto leader of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] (also known as the "baquartet"), a posse of "insignificant" Touhou characters.

In Russian she is known as [i]Сырно[/i] (Sɨrno), which literally translates as "cheesy" (in adverb form). In Finnish she is known as [i]Sirkku[/i] (post #673220).

h4. See also

* [[Circled 9]] (⑨)
* [[Cirno Day]] (9th September)
* [[Cirno-nee]], an [[aged up]], much more mature rendition
* [[Advent Cirno]], a series depicting her in the style of [[Cloud Strife]] of [[Final Fantasy VII]]
* [[Achi Cirno]], a fire-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Ikazu Cirno]], a lightning-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Mizu Cirno]], a water-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Hapa Cirno]], a leaf-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Tanned Cirno]], as she appears in [[Hidden Star In Four Seasons]]
* [[Nineball=Cirno]], a [[M.U.G.E.N]] character which changes Cirno's color palette to match [[Armored Core]]'s [[Nineball Seraph]]
* pool #1567: Cirno - ⑨⑨⑨x⑨⑨⑨ (Cirno images with dimensions exactly 999x999)
* pool #4616: Cirno Is Not So ⑨ (Cirno portrayed as smarter or cleverer than usual)

h4. External links

title: interstella_5555
body:
[b]Interstella 5555: The 5tory of the 5ecret 5tar 5ystem[/b] (インターステラ5555, Intāsutera Fō Faibu?, "Four Five") is a feature-length Japanese animated musical film originally released on December 1, 2003.

The film is the visual realization of [i]Discovery[/i], an album by the [[France|French]] electronic music duo [[Daft Punk]]. Each track from the album has been animated as an episode in the story of the abduction and rescue of an interstellar pop band. 

The film was produced by Daft Punk, Cédric Hervet and Emmanuel de Buretel along with [[Toei Animation]], under the supervision of [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. The film has no dialogue and minimal sound effects.

title: anata_wo_hannin_desu
body:
Meme stemming from a typo in [[Tsukihime]], wherein [[Hisui (tsukihime)|]]'s line "anata wa hannin desu" ("you are the criminal/culprit") was misprinted in the game as "anata wo hannin desu" ("you, be the criminal/culprit!"). 

This incident was seized upon by fans and Type-Moon alike, and gave rise to the Hisui brainwashing meme, as well as the [[brainwasher_detective|Brainwasher Detective]] character.

title: super_bunyan_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class variant of [[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]] introduced in [[Mississippi Mythicizers]]. She appears [[aged up|older]] than her Berserker self, only to return to her usual height (if not shorter) in her third ascension. Her hat conceals a pair of [[rabbit ears]], and if she leaves her hat off for too long, she also grows [[antlers]], making her resemble a [[jackalope]].

As an Alter Ego servant, her heroic spirit components include [[Rider (learning with manga! fgo)|]], [[Assassin (learning with manga! fgo)|]], and [[Mike Fink (fate)|]]. [spoiler]"Nanabozho":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanabozho snuck in as part of Mike Fink, who eroded her spirit origin, causing him to manifest in her place, only mimicking her soul. Unfortunately for him, Super Bunyan's personality had a stronger ego and self-interest than his, so he in turn became sealed away inside her psyche. If Bunyan ever manages to find peace of mind within herself, Nanabozho will resurface and completely take over, resulting in the complete erasure of Bunyan's personality.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Omigawa Chiaki]]

title: wakaba_mutsumi
body:
Character from [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]]. She is a guitarist in [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]], playing a [[7-string guitar|7-string]] [[Schecter Guitar]]. Her mother is [[Mori Minami]].

She is voiced by [[Watase Yuzuki]].

h6. The rest of this wiki contains spoilers for [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|BanG Dream! Ave Mujica]] from Episode 3 and beyond.

In Episode 3 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|Ave Mujica]] it is revealed that Mutsumi has "dissociative identity disorder":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissociative_identity_disorder, which lead to the creation of multiple split personalities, one of which is [[Mortis (persona) (bang dream!)|]]. While Mutsumi is usually a quiet girl and a proficient [[electric guitar|guitar]] player, Mortis is childish and incapable of playing the guitar.

For tagging purposes, [[Mortis (costume) (bang dream!)|]] should be added when the Mortis outfit (as shown below) is present or being worn. [[Mortis (persona) (bang dream!)|]] should be added when Mutsumi exhibits behavior indicative of Mortis currently being in control of the physical body. This includes out-of-character behavior (like in post #8781433), but also references to anime scenes where Mortis was in control (like [[Kenkou ni yoku nai! (bang dream!)|]]). Common depictions also include [[dual persona]] and [[multiple persona]] interacting.

[[Mortis (persona) (bang dream!)|Mortis]] (and later Mutsumi herself) are also depicted as [[doll]]s while in the [[Mutsumi/Mortis headspace]], see [[Wakaba Mutsumi (doll)]].

title: bang_dream!_it's_mygo!!!!!
body:
BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!! is an anime in the [[BanG Dream!]] franchise. It aired from June 29, 2023 until September 14, 2023, with a second part titled BanG Dream! Ave Mujica airing from January 2, 2025 until March 27, 2025. After the final episode, a new season was announced.

The series also includes two comics:
* [i]BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!! Ame ni Soyoide Hare o Kou[/i], Illustrated by [[Yuama]] with screenplay by "Haibuti Yotsuzi":https://twitter.com/haibuti_yotsuzi. Started serialization on December 27, 2024.
* [i]BanG Dream! Ave Mujica -manuscriptus-[/i] by [[Hiroyama Pinfu]]. Started serialization on January 10, 2025.

In addition to the series having similar themes, on 2024-07-05, a joint live concert between [[MyGO!!!!! (bang dream!)|]] and [[Girls Band Cry]]'s [[Togenashi Togeari]] on 2025-01-12 "was":[https://twitter.com/bang_dream_info/status/1809067177053728832] "announced":[https://twitter.com/girlsbandcry/status/1809067702126063829], prompting a lot of [[crossover]] fanart.

title: kirby's_epic_yarn
body:
The first [[Kirby_(series)|]] game on the Nintendo [[Wii]]. Not unlike [[Kirby Canvas Curse]], this is not a conventional [i]Kirby[/i] game. Kirby is no longer able to suck things up and gain [[copy ability|copy abilities]] (as air passes through his now-made-of-yarn body), so he relies on a yarn whip to pull enemies to him and throw them at obstacles.

A [[Nintendo 3DS]] port released in 2019 called [[Kirby's Extra Epic Yarn]], which introduces some quality-of-life enhancements as well as new minigames featuring [[King Dedede]] and [[Meta Knight]].

title: mg34
body:
The [B]MG34[/b] is a 7.92×57mm Mauser [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] used by Nazi Germany before and during [[World War II]]. Introduced in 1934, it was considered the first [[machine gun]]. It features a quick-change barrel, a tubular [[barrel shroud]] with circular perforation, a [[bipod]], conical [[muzzle device]] and [[flip-up sight|flip-up iron sights]].
The MG34 was not suitable for quick mass production and costly. So it was supplanted by the [[MG42]] despite both remained in service.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG34 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links

title: taisui_xingjun_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class welfare Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A Chinese mythological god said to be the deified form of "Tai Sui":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tai_Sui, a planet that mirrors Jupiter. The [[Chinese zodiac]] is based on divisions of Jupiter's orbital cycle rather than the Sun's in the Western zodiac, so Taisui is able to define whether any given year will be lucky or unlucky by using the 12 zodiac signs multiplied by the five Chinese elements (fire, earth, metal, water, and wood), or 60 divisions.

In Fate/Grand Order, he is created by the fusion of countless [[Con (fate)|]]. He usually appears in a child form, only changing to his adult form when using his [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], as he considers himself too dangerous to stay in his adult form as a god of misfortune regularly.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Take (illustrator)|]]
[b]Voice Actor (Child):[/b] [[Minami Omi]]
[b]Voice Actor (Adult):[/b] [[Kawanishi Kengo]]

title: trung_trac_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. [[Trung Nhi (fate)|]]'s sister and partner, appearing together as a single Saber-class Servant. The Trung sisters (also known as Hai Bà Trưng, 'Two Ladies Named Trưng') were Vietnamese military leaders who ruled for three years after rebelling in AD 40 against the first Chinese domination of Vietnam, and are regarded as national heroines of Vietnam.

Trung Trac has green-tinted hair, aqua eyes, and has lighter skin. She is supposedly the older of the two. Her name is stylized as [b]Trưng Trắc[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Take (illustrator)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kondou Reina]]

title: lakia_amarga
body: The tertiary Rider of [[Kamen Rider Gavv (series)|]]. Lakia's brother, Connel, was killed due to his addiction to the Stomach Family's sweets. Swearing revenge, Lakia poses as another addict to get in their good graces, eventually being chosen by [[Nyelv Stomach]] for a surgery made to create someone to fight the human world's anti-Granute Kamen Riders, allowing Lakia to transform into [[Kamen Rider Vram]]. He eventually allies himself with [[Inoue Shouma|Shoma]], realizing he should use his power to fight the Stomach Company rather than aid them.
other_names: グラニュート・ラーゲ9

title: clair_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Clair[/b], known as [b]Ibuki[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

She is a proud, confident Gym Leader who uses Dragon-type Pokémon. Her cousin Lance is also a Dragon-type Pokémon user [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Kingdra]]. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]]. In [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]], she wears [[tooth earrings]], a [[black choker]], a neck [[pearl (gemstone)|]], a [[black cape]], a [[two-tone bodysuit|two-tone]] [[blue bodysuit]], [[blue gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[knee boots]]

title: kantaris_(time_crisis)
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Time Crisis (series)|]] games. Introduced in the first game's secret mission of the PlayStation version, she is a weapons dealer working with the terrorist Wild Dog and his mercenary army where VSSE agent Richard Miller inflirates her secret weapons factory disguise as a hotel, where depending on the players actions, Richard kills Kantaris or Kantaris escapes.

Kantaris returns in Time Crisis: Project Titan, where she is supplying Wild Dog with a robot army. During the game, Richard sneaks in into her personal yacht to rescue fellow VSSE agent Marisa "Abacus" Soleil after her real identity is discovered. Unlike the previous game, Richard doesn't confront Kantaris and is the only antagonist to escape unscathed by the end of the game.

Along with Wild Dog and Wild Fang, Kantaris is the only recurring female antagonist in the Time Crisis games.

title: cu_chulainn_alter_(curruid_coinchenn)_(fate)
body:
[b]"Beast of Crunching Deathtusk"[/b]

[[cu chulainn alter (fate)|Cu Chulainn Alter]]'s Noble Phantasm. He summons the skeleton of the sea monster [[Curruid (fate)|]] and wears it as armor.

title: curruid_(fate)
body: A sea monster from Celtic mythology, its bones are said to be the material used to craft [[Gae Bolg (fate)|]]. Was apparently fierce rivals with another sea monster, Coinchenn, for dominance of the ocean. Curruid appears in the Craft Essence [b]Beast of Billows[/b], and the bones are worn as an offensive exoskeleton for [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]]’s [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], [[cu chulainn alter (curruid coinchenn) (fate)|Curruid Coinchenn]].

title: time_crisis
body:
The first game in the [[time_crisis_(series)|Time Crisis series]]. Released in 1995 in the arcades and later ported to the [[PlayStation 1]] in 1997.

Set in the fictional nation of Sercia, which has overthrown the old authoritarian Royal family and elected it's first President, William MacPherson. However, Sherudo Garo, the last survivor of the royal family, wants revenge and the return of the monarchy under his rule, launches a series of attacks on the Sercian nation with the help of the terrorist Wild Dog and his army of mercenaries. During these attacks, Sherudo kidnaps Williams daughter, Rachel, and gives an ultimatum to the President; give up Sercian military secrets to Sherudo and restoration of the Monarchy for his daughter's life. In desperation, William contacts the intelligence agency VSSE (Vital Situation, Swift-Elimination) for help, who send in one of their best agents, Richard Miller. Richard is sent to Sherudo's fortress where he battles Wild Dog's army to save Rachel. 

The PlayStation version includes an extra storyline "Kantaris Deal", set weeks after the events of the main game where Richard is sent to a Sercian hotel that is secretly a weapons factory controlled by the weapons dealer [[Kantaris (time crisis)|]], Wild Dog's supplier.

The game would later get a PlayStation only sequel, Time Crisis: Project Titan, in 2001. The player once again plays as Richard Miller, where he is framed for assassination of the Caruban president Xavier Serrano. Given 48 hours to prove his innocent, Richard must find the truth on who actually killed the President and learns his old enemies, Wild Dog and Kantaris are involved.

title: tyranno_ranger
body:
The Red Ranger of [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], better known to American viewers as the [[Mighty Morphin Red Ranger]]. [[Yamato Zoku Prince Geki]] serves in the role.

In [[Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger]], [[Captain Marvelous]] and [[Ikari Gai]] would use the Tyranno Ranger [[Ranger Key]]. In [[No.1 Sentai Gozyuger]], as part of the Universe Warriors, the role is served by [[Oosai Meguru]].

title: no.1_sentai_gozyuger
body:
The 49th series, and 50th anniversary series, of [[Super Sentai]].

Due to Gozyuger featuring a multiversal story which involves the [[Sentai Ring]]s with the powers of past Sentai Reds, art from this series can look like art from other series. 

h4. Characters

* [[Tono Hoeru|]] / [[GozyuWolf]]
* [[Byakuya Rikuo]] / [[GozyuLeon]]
* [[Bakugami Ryugi]] / [[GozyuTyranno]]
* [[Takehara Kinjiro]] | Takehara Jouji / [[GozyuEagle]]
* [[Ichikawa Sumino]] / [[GozyuUnicorn]]

h5. Universe Warriors

* [[Tsutsumi Natsume]] / [[Kuwagata Ohger]] ([[Ohsama Sentai King-Ohger]])

* Sakuraba / [[Ryusoul Red]] ([[Kishiryu Sentai Ryusoulger]])
* [[Oosai Meguru]] / [[Tyranno Ranger]] ([[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]])
** [[Daizyuzin]]

h4. See also

* [[Tega Sword]]
* [[Sentai Ring]]

title: hephaestion_(fate)
body:
[[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] character. A Servant summoned by [[Doctor Heartless]]. She is considered to be [b]Iskandar's Shadow[/b], and is actually [[Hephaestion (fate) (non-official)|Hephaestion]]'s younger twin sister who worked as Iskandar's body double. Due to her lack of a proper name and identity, she is not seen as part of [[Ionioi Hetairoi (fate)|]]. She has subtle [[heterochromia]], with her left eye being [[blue eyes|blue]] and her right eye [[grey eyes|grey]], though it's not uncommon for both to be the [[no heterochromia|same color]] (usually blue) either due to artistic license or [[artistic error]]. When using her [[mystic eyes]], they turn [[orange eyes|orange]].

She was released in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a Pretender-class Servant remembering all the events of her previous summoning as a Faker, going by the name Hephaestion. [spoiler]Her true name as a Pretender is revealed to actually be [b]Hephaestion [[Mnemosyne (fate)|]][/b].[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sakamoto Mineji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Taichi You]]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25704639: Faker
* !post #9239048: Pretender
* !post #9239049: Second Ascension
* !post #9239051: Third Ascension

h4. Costumes
* !post #6810812: [[Hephaestion (Day and Night) (fate)|Day and Night]]
* !post #7947138: [[Hephaestion (Exhibition Attire) (fate)|Exhibition Attire]]

* "Type-Moon Wiki - Pretender":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Hephaestion_Mnemosyne
* "Fate/Grand Order Wiki":https://fategrandorder.fandom.com/wiki/Hephaestion

title: yukkuri_reimu_(team_yukkuri)
body:
A main member of [[Team Yukkuri]].

She is a woman with [[brown_hair|brown]] [[short hair]], wearing a [[crop top]] and [[white headband]]. She is heavily addicted to [[nuka_cola_quantum|Nuka Cola Quantums]] and has a strange fear of "repellent sticks.":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Repellent_stick One of her catch phrases is "[i]Nozomi ga Tatareta![/i] (All our hopes are ruined!)" (It is a translation error of "This is hopeless!!" in the Japanese translation of [[Fallout 3]])

title: lunealter
body: [[ai-generated|AI]] prompter. Do not upload.

title: casablanca_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy escort carrier USS [i]Casablanca[/i] (CVE-55) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Suika01]], voiced by [[Hasegawa Ikumi]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] silvery [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a thermal [[blue jacket]], [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]], red [[necktie]], [[blue skirt]], [[pantyhose]], [[thigh boots]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of the two halves of her [[flight deck]], each with the number 55 painted on it, with additional mini hull pieces attached to the waist. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3836614: Default
* !post #3836615: [[Casablanca (cheer squad on break) (azur lane)|Cheer Squad on Break]]

h4. [i]Casablanca[/i]-class escort carrier

* [b]Casablanca[/b] (CVE-55)

h4. See also

* [[Gambier Bay (Kancolle)|Her younger sister ship Gambier Bay (kancolle)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Casablanca[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Casablanca]
other_names: カサブランカ(アズールレーン)

title: wa_maid
body:
A traditional Japanese [[maid]]. It usually means a [[yukata]] or a relatively simple [[kimono]] with a [[maid apron]] and an optional [[maid headdress]]. A classic example is [[Tsukihime]]'s [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]].

If a Western maid outfit is also present in the image, tag [[mixed maids]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6973173

h4. See also

* [[Wa Lolita]]
* [[Maid]]
* [[Unconventional maid]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: dobrynya_nikitich_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[Tunguska Sanctuary (fate/grand order)|]] event. She is actually not Dobrynya himself, but rather his [[giantess]] wife Nastasia taking on his name. Her [[dragon]] mount is named [[Burko (fate)|]].

title: list_of_goddess_of_victory:_nikke_characters
body:
List of characters from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

h4. Playable characters

Playable characters are divided into one of 5 categories: three for Ark Nikkes (based on which of the Big Three Ark corporations manufactured them), one for surface Nikkes, and one for crossover characters.

h5. Elysion

Uphold the belief in Nikkes serving as first-rate soldiers, Elysion effectively serves as a private military corporation. Its CEO is [[Ingrid (nikke)|]].

[expand=List]
* [[Anchor (nikke)|]]
** [[Anchor (Innocent maid) (nikke)|]]

[/expand]

h5. Missilis Industry

Missilis specializes in cutting edge technology. Its CEO is [[Syuen (nikke)|]].

h5. Tetra Line

To Tetra Line, the battlefield is a form of entertainment. Apart from the production of Nikkes, Tetra Line also specializes in fashion and daily necessities. Its CEO is [[Mustang (nikke)|]].

h5. Pilgrim

An umbrella term used to refer to Nikkes living on the surface, unaligned with the Big Three of the Ark. [[Andersen (nikke)|]] of the Central Government sees himself as a "representative" for the Pilgrims.

[expand=List]
* [[Cinderella (nikke)|]]

[/expand]

h5. Abnormal

A company that manages the existence of Nikke-like individuals. Characters from collaboration events fall into this category.

[expand=List]
h6. [[Chainsaw Man]]
* [[Makima (chainsaw man)|]]
* [[Himeno (chainsaw man)|]]
* [[Power (chainsaw man)|]]

h6. [[Neon Genesis Evangelion|Evangelion]]

* [[Katsuragi Misato]]

* [[Ram (re:zero)|]]
* [[Rem (re:zero)|]]
[/expand]


h4. Squads

Nikke are grouped into named squads of 1-4 members. Usually squads have a particular role or specialization, which often is reflected in the squad name or in the names of individual members. Rarely a Nikke may leave one squad to join another, either temporarily or permanently, and under extraordinary circumstances a squad may be dissolved. [b]Only use these tags for posts that feature all permanent members of a squad.[/b]

[expand=List]
Names in [i]italics[/i] denote squads with only one known member; they are included for the sake of completeness, but there isn't any reason to use them as tags.
* [[777 (nikke)|]]
* [[Absolute (nikke)|]]
* [[A.C.P.U. (nikke)|]]
* [i]Academia[/i]

title: mp18
body:
The [b]MP18[/b] ([i]Maschinenpistole 18[/i]) is a [[gun|firearm]] designed by "Hugo Schmeisser":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugo_Schmeisser, the very first open-bolt [b][[submachine gun]][/b] ever. Predominantly chambered in 9×19mm round, it was introduced in 1918 by the Imperial German Army during World War I as the primary [[weapon]] of the "Stormtroopers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormtroopers_(Imperial_Germany). Its design became the basis for most of european SMGs manufactured between 1920 and 1960.

Unlike more modern SMGs, the MP18 featured a wooden rifle-styled buttstock without pistol grip, and relatively heavy due to thick milled receiver tube. Magazine is inserted on the left, and can accept the 32-round "snail" [[drum magazine]] designed for the [[luger p08|Artillery Luger]].

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MP28]]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "MP18":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MP_18

title: gundam_gquuuuuux
body:
A 2025 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] anime television series produced by [[Studio Khara]] ([[Rebuild of Evangelion]]) and [[Sunrise (company)|]]. It is a part of the [[Gundam]] franchise and has mechanical designs by [[Yamashita Ikuto]], who created the robots for [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

The series takes place in [b]Universal Century 0085[/b] (85 years after the creation of the first permanent colony in [[space]]) in an [[alternate universe|alternative timeline]] where [[Zeon]] successfully captured the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], which changed the outcome of [[mobile suit gundam|"The One Year War"]] (U.C. 0079).

title: acacia_(snowbreak)
body:
A character in [[Snowbreak: Containment Zone]]. A member of the Heimdall Force squad.

Underwent the qualification process of the Valkyrie Games (or other venues) and qualified to be a candidate for the Baldr Inhibitor. Awakener of a 30-year cryosleep session with an unknown past. Aside from the cryosleep itself, Acacia has not validates any other information. From the exceptional combat capabilities and behavioral patterns, it is probably true that she is ex-special forces.

Even after awakening from an "induced hibernation" of 30 years, the expressions on Acacia's face seem to still remain frozen. The way Acacia speaks does not fit modern society very well. She's obsessed with second-hand anime products, it wouldn't be wrong to deem her the guardian of otaku culture. Her collecting of these antiques not only satisfies her interests but is also a way for her to remember her past and friends.

h4. Exosuits/Outfits

* [[Acacia - Redacted (Snowbreak)|Redacted]] (Default)

title: sasha_(haguhagu)
body:
Full name, Alexandra Kournikova. An original character created by [[haguhagu_(rinjuu_circus)|haguhagu]]. She is a Russian middle school girl who works as a junior idol in Japan. Originally the main character in several of haguhagu's eromanga, she is now the heroine of the manga series Sasha-chan to Classmate Otaku-kun (the "gone legit" work サーシャちゃんとクラスメイトオタクくん) alongside [[fujihara_(haguhagu)|Fujiwara Kazuki]]. 

This character features in several continuities, where the primary difference between continuities is the identity of her principal lover.  In all continuities, she is extremely promiscuous, up to and including secretly filming herself having sex so she can masturbate to it later. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], a [[flat chest]], and a [[fang]]. Her hair typically combed to show off her [[forehead]]. Most of her illustrations are suggestive when not explicit and should be tagged [[loli]].

title: red_gundam
body:
A fictional manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]].

[b]GMS-α Gundam[/b]

The recolored [[White Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] [spoiler]when it was captured by [[Char Aznable]] of [[Zeon]] and revamped with an experimental Psycommu System and 6 [[bit_(gundam)|bits]] armed each with a [[beam cannon]] (which look similar to those of the [[Elmeth]]). Banished without a trace at the third Battle of Solomon during the [i]Zeknova Event[/i] (late U.C. 0079)[/spoiler]. 

[spoiler]In U.C. 0085 the unit mysteriously reappeared, this time piloted by [[Shuji Ito]].[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].

title: escape_from_tarkov
body:
A multiplayer tactical first-person shooter with RPG and survival elements developed by Battlestate Games for [[Microsoft Windows]], where the player assumes the role of a private military contractor working for one of two rival companies, the NATO-backed United Security (USEC) and the Russian-backed Battle Encounter Assault Regiment (BEAR), as they attempt to complete the titular objective of escaping the city of Tarkov in Russia.

It is set in the [[Russia.2028]] universe, shared with Contract Wars.

title: with_handala_pose
body: A pose taken from the popular cartoon character [[Handala]] (Arabic: حنظلة, romanized: Ḥanẓala), created in 1969 by the late [[Palestine|Palestinian]] cartoonist Naji al-Ali. A national symbol and personification of the Palestinian people, Handala is often depicted facing away with his hands behind his back. His pose represents defiance towards [[Israel]] over its occupation of both the West Bank and the [[Gaza|Gaza Strip]]. h4. title: vietnam_war
body:
[b]The Vietnam War[/b] (Vietnamese: Chiến tranh Việt Nam), also known as the [b]Second Indochina War[/b], and known in [[Vietnam]] as the [b]Resistance War Against America[/b] (Vietnamese: Kháng chiến chống Mỹ) or simply [b]The American War[/b], was a war that occurred in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia from 1 November 1955 to the fall of Saigon on 30 April 1975. 

It was the second of the Indochina Wars and was officially fought between North Vietnam and the government of South Vietnam. 

North Vietnam was supported by the [[Soviet|Soviet Union]], [[China]] and other communist allies and South Vietnam was supported by the [[united states|United States]], [[South Korea]], [[Australia]], [[Thailand]] and other anti-communist allies. The war is therefore considered a [[Cold War]]-era proxy war.

The [[Viet Cong|National Liberation Front]] (known in the West by the insult "Viet Cong", or VC, meaning "Red Vietnamese"), a South Vietnamese communist common front aided by the North, fought a [[guerrilla]] war against anti-communist forces in the region, while the [[People's Army of Vietnam]], also known as the North Vietnamese Army (NVA), engaged in more conventional warfare, at times committing large units to battle. 

American involvement in the war peaked in 1968, the same year that the communist side launched the Tet Offensive. The Tet Offensive failed in its goal of overthrowing the South Vietnamese government, but became the turning point in the war, as it persuaded a large segment of the U.S. population that its government's claims of progress toward winning the war were illusory despite many years of massive U.S. military aid to South Vietnam. 

Direct U.S. military involvement ended on 15 August 1973, leaving South Vietnam's own military, the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]], to fight on alone. 

The capture of Saigon by the North Vietnamese Army in April 1975 marked the end of the war, and North and South Vietnam were reunified the following year under a communist government. 

Estimates of the number of Vietnamese soldiers and civilians killed vary from 966,000 to 3.8 million. Some 240,000–300,000 Cambodians, 20,000–62,000 Laotians and 58,220 U.S. service members also died in the conflict, and a further 1,626 remain missing in action.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Vietnam War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam_War]

h4. See Also

* [[First Indochina War]]
* [[tag_group:history]]
* [[PTSD]]

title: mysterious_ranmaru_x_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[GUDAGUDA Ryouma Kiki Ippatsu!]] event. Like [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]], she is from the Servant Universe, specifically Planet Ranmaru. She is a version of [[Mori Nagayoshi (fate)|]]'s brother, Mori Ranmaru. She keeps her right eye covered with an [[eyepatch]], hiding a [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes|red eye]].

Her gender is listed as unknown, and uses her own name (Ranmaru) as a personal pronoun. She states that whether she is a boy or a girl depends on "her Ranmanium growth cycles".

title: tenjin_hidetaka
body:
[[Japan]]ese [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] illustrator born in Nishinomiya, Kobe City (Hyogo prefecture) on October 13, 1973. After graduating from the Shibaura lnstitute of Technology's Department of System Engineering (majoring in mechanical control systems), he became a freelance illustrator.

Later he established the [b]Tenjin Studio Ltd.[/b], where he began working on plastic model box art, software and DVD cover art, illustrations, etc. - the most well know being for [[Macross]], [[Gundam]], [[Gradius V]], etc. He also did animation work on the [[Macross Zero]], [[Sousei no Aquarion]] and on the Gundam Evolve anime productions. 

He has declared that his [[realistic]] art style is influenced by the works of [[Takani Yoshiyuki]].

title: whitebeard_pirates
body:
One of the strongest [[pirate]] crews in the world of [[One Piece]], with several ships, 16 divisions, and a large number of allies.

[spoiler]After the deaths of [[Portgas D. Ace|Ace]] and [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard]] at [[Marineford]], their current activities are unknown.[/spoiler]

title: zanzaburou_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. His living name was Nagoya Sansaburou, a samurai who died in 1603. [[Izumo no Okuni (fate)|]] performed a kabuki play based on his life, and it's said her beautiful singing voice caused his spirit to return to dance with her. In Fate/Grand Order, Zanzaburou appears as a large [[samurai]] [[robot]] who accompanies Okuni with her attacks and Noble Phantasm.

The [i]zan[/i] kanji in his name, as well as on his helmet, means [i]beheading[/i].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[NOCO (adamas)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Mafia Kajita]]

title: izumo_no_okuni_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[GUDAGUDA Ryouma Kiki Ippatsu!]] event. A [[miko|shrine maiden]] credited as the progenitor of [[kabuki]] dance. One story claims that Okuni performed a show based on Nagoya Sansaburou, and her singing voice lured his spirit back to perform a dance with her. He is summoned with her as [[Zanzaburou (fate)|]], a heavily-armored samurai who attacks with her.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[NOCO (adamas)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Uesaka Sumire]]

title: vivian_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A character from [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. Member of the Mockingbird, despite her noble-like appearance, she is known to be working on several part-time jobs.

She is a hardcore fan of the Proxy "Phaethon", although she only learned that they were in fact [[belle (zenless zone zero)|two]] [[wise_(zenless zone zero)|individuals]] when she first met them. 

h4. Official art

* !post #9196669: Profile

body: The mascot/avatar for the youtuber Zesty Jesus

title: sanrio
body:
Sanrio Co., Ltd is a Japanese company that creates a range of (mostly) design series that features characters, and sells and licenses various products branded with these characters. These products include stationery, school supplies, gifts and accessories. Sanrio's best known character is [[Hello Kitty (character)|]], a white cat with red bow and no mouth. Hello Kitty is one of the most successful marketing brands in the world.

title: bionicle
body:
A [[the lego group|LEGO]] [[toy]]line of constraction figures that ran from 2000 to 2010. The series features many [[science fiction]] elements as well as influence from Maori aesthetics and language, and is notable for having incredibly expansive lore and an ongoing story throughout the line's lifetime. The lore was spread across a variety of mediums, including books, comics, video games, flash games, podcasts, and 4 feature-length films.

LEGO rebooted the line in 2015, with a new continuity and completely different art style. The reboot featured several books, graphic novels, animated web shorts, and an animated series on [[Netflix]], before being discontinued in 2016.

Despite the line being in a dormant state and having no new official content releases or reprints of previous sets, the series has retained a large fanbase that consistently creates new content.

h4. See also

* [[Kanohi (Bionicle)|]]
* [[Matoran Language]]
* [[Hero Factory]] - spiritual successor line that briefly replaced Bionicle after its discontinuation

h4. External links

* "BioMediaProject":[http://biomediaproject.com/bmp/] - unofficial archive site, contains promotional materials, flash games, and other Bionicle media that has since been removed from the official Lego website (part of the broader MaskOfDestiny project)
* "BIONICLEsector01":[https://biosector01.com/wiki/Main_Page] - unofficial database of BIONICLE information, the largest and most comprehensive within the fanbase

title: type_26_revolver
body:
The [b]Type 26[/b] was a [[break action|top-break]] double-action only [b][[revolver]][/b] adopted by the Imperial Japanese Army. It was named for its year of adoption (the 26th year of the [[Meiji]] era, 1893).
Chambered in proprietary 9×22mmR Type 26 cartridge, the [[weapon]] features an octagonal barrel with embedded front sight and a spurless hammer.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Nambu Type 14]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 62 revolver":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_26_revolver

title: nail_ornament
body:
A small decoration worn on the nails as a part of [[nail art]], often related to [[decoden]]. The piece may be a small [[gem]] or [[rhinestone]], or a plastic charm, or a resin cabochon.

h4. See also

* [[Fake nails]]
* [[Gem-studded nails]]
* [[Nail polish]]
* [[Ring]]
* [[Charm (object)]]

title: decoden
body:
The practice of decorating [[cellphone]] cases, [[handheld game console]]s, [[mirror]]s and other household objects with many different materials. This tag also includes [[nail art]] that uses an excessive amount of [[nail ornament|additional decorations]], such as post #7865677.

Typically this involves the use of [[sticker]]s, [[rhinestone]]s, [[charm (object)|]]s, small cabochons and resin pieces, [[bow]]s, and more. It is also common to see a "whipped cream" effect.

It is a common activity associated with various Japanese street fashion styles such as [[decora]], [[yume kawaii]] and [[gyaru]].

h4. See also

* [[itabag]]

body:
[b]Ano Natsu de Matteru[/b] (あの夏で待ってる, lit. title: meiji_(brand)
body:
A Japanese dairy and confectionery company, established by the stock transfer and reorganization from two independent companies, Meiji Seika (明治製菓, Meiji Confectionery) and Meiji Dairies (明治乳業). Initially, Meiji Seika was also a pharmaceutical company, but after the merger with Meiji Dairies, its confectionery business was taken over to Meiji Co., Ltd. while the pharmaceutical business was reorganized into Meiji Seika Pharma (Meiji Seikaファルマ).

h4. Products

* [[Meiji black chocolate|Black Chocolate]]
* [[Meiji white chocolate|White Chocolate]]

title: takasugi_shinsaku_(fate)
body: [[Fate/Grand Order]] character. A central figure in the early [[Meiji]] Restoration during the 1860s, who put all his efforts into opening the way to modernization, westernization and reforms, not only in military matters but in political and social matters as well. He died of tuberculosis at only 28 years old.

body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life [[Meiji]]/[[Taishou]]-era poet Akiko Yosano (1878-1942). Voiced by [[Shimamura Yuu]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[butterfly hair ornament]], and [[purple eyes]]; her outfit is composed of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black necktie]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[red shoes|red]] [[high heels]].

title: ee_ja_nai_ka
body: "Ee ja nai ka" was a protest movement that took place in Japan around 1867-1868, at the end of the [[Edo Jidai|Edo Period]]. These protests often involved dancing and celebrations and went on until the beginning of the [[Meiji]] Restoration. "Ee ja nai ka" can be translated as "Why the heck not".

body:

Posts with this tag refer to or [[fine art parody|parody]] artworks using such style.

title: chonmage
body: A type of [[nihongami]]; a traditional Japanese men's [[topknot]] haircut. Commonly depicted on [[samurai]], and still used by [[sumo]] wrestlers. It was traditionally tied with a [[motoyui]]. The chonmage came to an end during the [[Meiji]] era, when men were ordered by decree to cut their hair short, in what was known as the Dampatsurei Edict. A variant called wakashumage (若衆髷) refers to the hairstyle worn by boys before coming of age (around 15 years old). The wakashumage hairstyle was also adopted by women during the early Edo period. For the hairstyle that sticks upright rather than being folded over against the scalp, see [[chasenmage]]. h4. Examples * !post #1257361: Chonmage with a [[shaved head]], from the [[edo_jidai|Edo Period]] * !post #7945605: History of the wakashumage variant h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Chonmage":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chonmage]

title: tsuki_ga_kirei_desu_ne_(phrase)
body:
This tag should be used when the phrase "月が綺麗ですね" ("The Moon Is Beautiful, Isn’t It?") or any reference to it is present. This phrase is related to a very well-known but unconfirmed anecdote about the Japanese [[Meiji]] Era novelist "Natsume Souseki.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsume_Sōseki 

During his time as an English teacher, when a student translated "I love you" into Japanese as literally as "我君ヲ愛ス", he is said to have remarked, "A Japanese person would never say something so unromantic. Translate it as 'The Moon Is Beautiful, Isn’t It? (月が綺麗ですね)', that will get the point across."
Some claim what he actually said was "The moon sure is beautiful when I'm with you.", but no reliable sources for this story have been found in the first place, so there is a high probability that the episode was a literary invention or an urban legend. What can be said with certainty is that this story had spread long before it was popularized on the internet and worldwide web.

A parallel episode is a story about when "Futabatei Shimei":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Futabatei_Shimei translated "Turgenev's":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Turgenev "Asya", and translated the eponymous heroine's "I love you" as "I wouldn't mind if I die. (死んでもいいわ)" This is clearly known to be fallacious. It was written on "the blog":http://lab.flama.co.jp/archives/398/ of "an IT engineer":http://lab.flama.co.jp/ in 2011, and while he did find a place in Shimei's translation that says "I wouldn't mind if I die.", the corresponding line in the original Russian version says, "Ваша…" ("[I am] yours...")
Since it was Shimei who gave this novella the Japanese title of "Unrequited Love (片戀/片恋)", his superb sensibilities and policy as a translator have made this legend more persuasive.

h4. External links

* Pixpedia: "月が綺麗ですね":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E6%9C%88%E3%81%8C%E7%B6%BA%E9%BA%97%E3%81%A7%E3%81%99%E3%81%AD 
* Weblio: "月が綺麗ですね":https://www.weblio.jp/content/%E6%9C%88%E3%81%8C%E7%B6%BA%E9%BA%97%E3%81%A7%E3%81%99%E3%81%AD
* Nicopedia: http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4505491

title: rising_sun_flag
body:
The symbol of the former [[Imperial Japanese Army]] and [[Imperial Japanese Navy|Navy]] and the current naval ensign of [[Japan]], still used in the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]. It has a red sun with sixteen rays on a white field, with the sun being off-center to the left in the naval ensign version.

* !asset #20077384: Current flag of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.

Mostly confused as the Empire of Japan's state flag during the [[Meiji]]-era until end of World War II (Empire of Japan at the time use the same flag as today's Japan). Commonly viewed in other Asian countries (especially [[China]] and [[Korea]]) as a symbol of Japanese aggression and colonialism. Many Japanese, however, disagree with this view.

title: jidaigeki
body:
A [[Japan]]ese period drama, generally set during the [[Heian]] (794–1185 CE), [[Sengoku Jidai|Sengoku]] (1467–1615 CE), [[Edo Jidai|Edo]] (1603–1868 CE), or Early [[Meiji]] eras of Japanese history.

Generally features [[samurai]] (or [[ronin]]) as main characters, with feudal lords, shoguns, ninjas, peasants, craftsmen and merchants also playing important parts. Often focuses on intense sword-fights between samurai and other sword-wielding characters.

Characters will usually dress in the period-appropriate attire in such works. Some characters (often the more 'regal' or 'authoritative' ones) will speak in a faux "antiquated stage Japanese", analogous to using "thees and thous" and other 'Shakespearisms' in an English work.

Drawn works set in a jidaigeki setting will often feature a [[sumi-e]] "ink wash" aesthetic or other elements of traditional Japanese art.

For tagging purposes, any post that depicts a visibly "Medieval Japanese" setting generally counts. Consider this the Japanese culture equivalent of the [[Medieval]] tag. Avoid tagging [[Touhou]] works with this tag, or other mixed fantastical/sci-fi settings, unless they have the distinct "jidaigeki" feel. 

(This may be hard to quantify, but generally, if it feels like a "samurai period piece film", then it counts, even if it's a mixed setting.)

h4. Tag usage notes

* Tag jidaigeki for posts that feature a visibly Japanese 'Medieval' theme.
** Especially if it focuses on samurai and feudal lords/shoguns, analogous to knights and lords for Western [[Medieval]] works.
* Avoid tagging jidaigeki for mixed settings unless one is  sure that it qualifies.
* Avoid tagging jidaigeki for settings that have a central focus on fantastical or 'magical' elements, even if set in the appropriate era.
** Generally these will focus on gods, magic, youkai and the like. 
** e.g. [[Ookami (game)|Ōkami]] (it is also set in prehistoric Japan instead of 'medieval' Japan.)
** The analogy is like [[medieval]] vs. [[fantasy]]. There is some overlap, and some posts may qualify for both. Likewise, some overtly fantastical or 'magical' settings may also [i]feel[/i] jidaigeki if there is significant focus on samurai characters (or feudal lords, or "the common people").
* [[Ninja]]s by themselves generally do not count for jidaigeki. 

h4. Notable series

* [[Kozure Ookami]] [tn]Edo period[/tn]
* [[Vagabond]] [tn]Edo period[/tn]
* [[Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice]] [tn]Sengoku period, with some fantastical and steampunk elements[/tn]
* [[Rurouni Kenshin]] [tn]Early Meiji period[/tn]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jidaigeki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jidaigeki]

title: okinawa
body:
The southernmost prefecture of [[Japan]], consisting of [b]Okinawa island[/b] proper and most of the islands of the Ryuukyuu chain. A tropical island that once was an independent kingdom. 

Throughout history it was a crossroad of trade from China and Southeast Asia to Japan. This is reflected in its culture which blends native elements with Japanese, Chinese, and Southeast Asian influences. Conquered by the Satsuma domain in 1609, Okinawa became part of the Japanese nation during the [[Meiji]] restoration. 

Site of [[battle of okinawa|one of the fiercest battles of the Pacific Theater]] in [[World War II]]. Occupied by the US Military after the war, it wasn't returned to Japanese control until 1972. Home to the majority of US bases in [[Japan]], which occupy 18% of the total land area. 

Okinawans (or Ryukyuans) are not a recognized minority group in Japan, as Japanese authorities consider them a subgroup of the Japanese people, akin to the Yamato people. The traditional Okinawan language is related to Japanese, and has been supplanted by the national language in most uses. Capital is Naha, historically it was Shuri, where Shuri Castle is located.

She usually wears a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]], consisting of a [[japanese clothes|traditional]] [[pink kimono|pink]] [[kimono]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print kimono|print]] and [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[red skirt|re]][[red hakama|d]]/[[purple skirt|pur]][[purple hakama|ple]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[hakama skirt|hakama]] [[skirt]] with a [[waist bow]], along with [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] on her legs.

title: edo_jidai
body:
The [b]Edo Jidai[/b], also known as the [b]Tokugawa Jidai[/b], was a time period in the history of feudal [[Japan]] from the year 1603 until 1867. It took place after the [[Sengoku Jidai]] and during this time Japan was unified and ruled by the [[tokugawa ieyasu|Tokugawa shogunate]], which closed the country to any foreign influence. The period ended with the [[Boshin War]] and the [[Meiji]] Restoration, events typically viewed as the start of modern Japan.

During the Edo period most [[samurai]] traditions and customs were refined to the extent that can be seen today in contemporary modern Japan.

title: boshin_war
body: A civil war fought in [[Japan]] from 1868-1869 between the [[edo jidai|Tokugawa Shogunate]] and forces seeking to restore Imperial power. Resulted in the overthrow and ending of the shogunate and the [[Meiji]] Restoration.

title: sarutobi_sasuke
body: Sarutobi Sasuke is a [[ninja]] who appears in kōdan narrative art and fictional writings. The nickname is generally believed to have been concocted from [[Meiji]] to the [[Taishou]] period. Some argue he is based on real live personages, such as Kōzuki Sasuke (上月佐助, Kōzuki Sasuke) and Sarutobi Nisuke (猿飛仁助, Sarutobi Nisuke).

title: orita_hikoichi_(statue)
body:
折田先生像 (Orita Sensei's Statue / Mr. Orita Statue) 

Orita Hikoichi (折田彦市, 1849-1920) was  an educationalist active in [[Meiji]] period Japan and and the first principal of the 3rd Higher School, one of predecessors of "Kyoto University.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyoto_University 
The motto of the university, "academic freedom" is based on his philosophy. 

His statue was settled  in front of the building of the Faculty of Liberal Arts (now the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies)  of the University in the 50's. 

Since around 80's, Mr. Orita was painted, defaced and the statue "[[cosplay]]ed" as random characters when the university has an event like the entrance exam. 
In 1994 the college started posting signs saying: 
[quote]折田彦市先生は、第三高等学校の校長として京大の創設に尽力し、京大に自由の学風を築くために多大な功績を残した人です。 どうかこの像を汚さないで下さい。 

総合人間学 
[/quote] 
[quote] 
As a school principal of the 3rd Higher School, Mr.Orita Hikoichi assisted in the founding of Kyoto University, and is a person who has left behind many achievements in pursuit of academic freedom at the University. Please do not mess up the statue. 

Faculty of Integrated Human Studies 
[/quote] 
Since then,  when Mr. Orita was painted, its parody text  was posted by this statue. 

In 1997, the statue finally left the campus basement. Immediately after that, however, a fake statue was set up where the real one stood. Since 2002, Mr. Orita's fake statues appeared in front of the Library of the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies almost every year around entrance exam season. 

The college once commented favorably to these acts "on their official webpage":http://web.archive.org/web/20080303042003/http://www.z.k.kyoto-u.ac.jp/news.cgi?type=information&row_id=2192 in 2008. 

h4. External links 

* "Japanese fanpage of Orita-sensei and his statue":http://sites.google.com/site/freedomorita/
* "Wikipedia article (JP): Orita Hikoichi":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8A%98%E7%94%B0%E5%BD%A6%E5%B8%82
* "Wikipedia article (JP): Mr. Orita Statue":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8A%98%E7%94%B0%E5%85%88%E7%94%9F%E5%83%8F
* "'Takeshi statue welcomes Kyoto University test-takers' from BulbaNews, 2010":http://bulbanews.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Takeshi_statue_welcomes_Kyoto_University_test-takers 
* "'Orita Sensei of Kyoto University' from 'watashi to tokyo'":http://smt.blogs.com/mari_diary/2005/10/orita_sensei_of.html

title: kimono
body:
A kimono (着物) is a type of traditional [[japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]]. It consists of a long, [[wide sleeves|wide-sleeved]] robe, closed at the front forming a "y" shape. It is held closed with a wide belt-like [[sash]] called an [[obi]]. The sleeves can be tied back with [[tasuki]].

Kimonos are often worn with other traditional accessories, such as [[zouri]] (traditional wooden sandals), [[tabi]] (split-toe socks), and [[kanzashi]] (traditional hair ornaments). A [[kinchaku]] (small cloth drawstring bag) is often carried while wearing a kimono.

h4.Correct examples

title: martha_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Martha was a saint of the 1st century said to have tamed a [[dragon]] named [[Tarasque (fate)|]]. She can summon said dragon as her Noble Phantasm. Typically acts like a calm female saint, except for the few times her actual boisterous country-girl personality emerges.

She has [[purple hair|purple]]-[[blue hair|bluish]] hair in [[hime cut]]. She wears a [[leotard]]-esque robe with a deep [[plunging neckline]] reaching her [[midriff]] section. Martha typically uses a [[cross]] [[staff]] in battle, though she will not hesitate to use her fist when unable to holding back her anger.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sakamoto Mineji]] 
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]]

title: eiko_carol
body: Playable character in [[Final Fantasy IX]]. A six-year-old [[summoner (final fantasy)|]] girl with a [[single horn]] and [[purple hair]], Eiko lives with the Moogles in Madain Sari until [[Zidane Tribal]]'s party meets her. She tries to win Zidane's affection, but it doesn't work so she tries to play matchmaker for Zidane and [[Garnet til Alexandros XVII]].

title: garnet_til_alexandros_xvii
body:
The main heroine of [[Final Fantasy IX]], she is the princess of Alexandria who tries to figure out why her mother [[brahne raza alexandros xvi|Brahne]] is attacking other nations. She allows [[Zidane Tribal]] to kidnap her, and she travels the world to find a way to save her mother.

Garnet is characterized as a white mage and summoner.

Her standard outfit includes an [[orange bodysuit]].
other_names: ガーネット・ティル・アレクサンドロス17世

title: kuja
body:
The main villain of [[Final Fantasy IX]], Kuja is an [[androgynous]]/[[otoko no ko]] sorcerer who reveals himself to be a cruel manipulator and an more extreme narcissist, and he is responsible for the majority of the game's events.

[b][i]Major spoilers[/i][/b]
[spoiler]He is responsible for manipulating [[Brahne Raza Alexandros XVI]] to go to war; extracting [[Garnet til Alexandros XVII]]'s eidolons and attempting to extract [[Eiko Carol]]'s eidolons; creating the Black Mages to use as killer soldiers, and verbally tortures [[Vivi Ornitier]] about it; causing the events that led to Alexandria's destruction (and inadvertently making Garnet lose her voice); betraying [[Garland (FF9)|]]; destroying the planet Terra; and then threatening to destroy Gaia when he discovers he doesn't have long to live. As a Genome given a soul by Garland, Kuja can be considered the older brother of [[Zidane Tribal]] and [[Mikoto (FF9)|]].[/spoiler]

title: loki_(marvel)
body:
[i]"I am Loki of Asgard, and I am burdened with glorious purpose."[/i]

Loki Laufeyson (or Odinson, depending on his current relationship with his family) is the adopted brother of [[Thor (marvel)|]] and is the god of mischief, outcasts, stories, lies, etc. He is portrayed by Tom Hiddleston in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].

Though he is a shapeshifter, his usual appearance is that of a thin young man with shoulder-length [[black hair]], green [[leather armor]] made from fine Asgardian leather with gold trimmings, and either a golden [[horned helmet]] or simpler [[horned headwear]].

Being a comic book character that has been around for decades, there have been several variants of Loki throughout the years, such as [[Kid Loki]] (a younger version of Loki who was reborn after the original was killed, King Loki (a future, evil(er) version of Loki), and Lady Loki (Loki shapeshifted into a woman). The [[Loki (disney+)|]] television series introduces various other variants, such as Classic Loki (an older variant of Loki based on the comic version, played by Richard E. Grant), Boastful Loki (a black, muscular variant of Loki who is a braggart, played by DeObia Oparei), [[Sylvie Laufeydottir]] (a female variant of Loki, played by Sophia Di Martino), and Alligator Loki (an alligator variant of Loki, played by a CG alligator).
other_names: ロキ・ラウフェイソン

title: nevada_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the battleship USS [i]Nevada[/i] (BB-36).  Her name is officially rendered as [i]Nevada [/i](ネヴァダ), although this has been historically interchanged with the spelling [i]Nebada[/i] (ネバダ), especially in the case of the historical battleship and her namesake state.

Nevada has three forms. Her base level mimicks her status when she was first built, her Kai level shows Nevada how she was during the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]], and her Kai Mod. 2 level shows Nevada's post-attack wartime refit. Nevada's clothing, hairstyle, and even eye color all change depending on her remodel level, but all three show Nevada with long [[red hair]] and wearing a [[sleeveless]], white [[collared shirt]], a greyish-brown dress, [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], and boots. 

At her base level, Nevada has [[red eyes]] and braided hair, a [[red neckerchief]], [[grey boots]], [[thigh strap]], and [[grey jacket]] with a white fringe-trimmed collar. Her [[rigging]] is entirely light grey color, with a distinctive large cage mast behind Nevada's head. Her damaged art shows she wears [[white bloomers]].

At Kai, Nevada now has a red-lined [[blue jacket]] with a black collar, [[red thighhighs]], and the bottom of her dress now has [[fringe trim]] while her collar does not anymore. Her rigging is now colored greyish-blue, her mast forms a tripod shape behind her head, and Nevada has a catapult "gun" carried in her right hand. 

At Kai Mod. 2, Nevada's eyes change to red and blue [[multicolored eyes]], her hair comes out of its braid but gains a metal [[hairband]], and her outfit loses any fringe trim. She now wears [[blue boots]] with a grey top, her jacket drops the red trim but gains a grey back, and she trades the red neckerchief for a [[red necktie]]. Her rigging includes extra [[anti-aircraft gun]]s attached to her hip via a sling, a large radar added to her tripod mast, and changes color again to be red/blue/grey in layers. Her damaged art also reveals that Nevada has also changed to [[black panties]].

Like [[Fletcher (Kancolle)|]], Nevada's three levels of upgrades result in all her seasonal outfits coming in three variants, depending on which remodel stage Nevada is at.

title: doctor_strange
body:
[[Marvel]] character, protagonist of the [[Doctor Strange (series)|homonymous series]], created by Steve Dikto and introduced in 1963.

Stephen Strange was a talented but arrogant surgeon from New York whose life changed after a car accident rendered his hand unusable. Desperate for a cure, he reached the Tibetan monastery of Kamar-Taj, where a sorcerer known only as the [[Ancient One]] instructed him in the mystic arts.
Strange eventually inherited the Ancient One's title as Sorcerer Supreme, and since then has been defending Earth from mystical and extradimensional threats such as [[Shuma Gorath]].
other_names: ドクター・ストレンジ
スティーヴン・ストレンジ

title: america_chavez
body:
America Chavez is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer Joe Casey and artist Nick Dragotta, the character first appeared in Vengeance #1 (September 2011). Chavez is a lesbian superhero.

She has assumed the mantle of Miss America from the superheroine Madeline Joyce. She has also been a member of the A-Force, the Ultimates, and the [[Young Avengers]] at various points in her history.

title: johnny_somali
body:
[b]Ramsey Khalid Ismael[/b], also known online as [b]Johnny Somali[/b], is a notorious Ethiopian-American live streamer and internet troll. 

Since 2023, Johnny is infamous for traveling to various foreign countries where he films himself harassing locals, causing public nuisance and offending people with insensitive topics (eg. mocking Japanese people about the Hiroshima and Nagasaki Atomic bombings during World War II or insulting Korean women who were forced into sexual slavery during Japanese occupation). His actions has been criticized online by many, including expats who live in those countries, since it gives foreigners visiting those countries a bad reputation with the locals and increase xenophobia.

As of 2025, Johnny is currently facing several charges in South Korea for sexual harassment, endangering minors and causing public disturbances.

title: pauline_(mario)
body:
Character from the [i][[Donkey Kong (series)|]][/i] and [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] franchises.

Originally called The Lady, she is the damsel in distress from [[Nintendo]]'s [i][[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|Donkey Kong]][/i] and its various remakes. Her most recent appearances are in the [i][[Mario Vs. Donkey Kong]][/i] series, as (again) the damsel in distress, and [i][[Super Mario Odyssey]][/i] as the mayor of New Donk City. She sometimes makes appearances in promotional art with the other girls of the [i]Mario[/i] series, officially known as the "Nintendo Starlets".

Her official appearance is [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with pink [[eyeshadow]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[red dress]]. Her [i]Odyssey[/i] appearance gives her an alternate outfit, changing the dress to a [[red suit]] with a [[fedora]].

title: pauline_(party_time)_(mario)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Pauline (Mario)|Pauline]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. She wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[halter shirt]] patterned after a [[disco ball]] and a [[red skirt|red]] [[medium skirt]] with [[sphere earrings]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[pearl bracelet]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]]. Her hair is also covered in [[heart hair ornament|hearts]] and [[star hair ornament|stars]], resembling [[sprinkles]].

title: pauline_(cowgirl)_(mario)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Pauline (Mario)|Pauline]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]], dressing her as a [[cowgirl]]. Wears a [[plaid shirt|plaid]] [[red shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], [[suspenders]], and [[buttons]], an [[open vest|open]] [[yellow vest]], and [[blue pants]] [[jeans]]. Also has on a [[red headwear|red]] [[cowboy hat]], [[earrings]] shaped like [[horseshoe|horseshoes]], [[brown gloves]], an [[orange belt]] with a [[heart-shaped buckle]], and [[red footwear]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[cowboy boots]].

title: princess_daisy
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. She is the princess of Sarasaland. Cheerful, energetic, and a bit tomboyish.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]].
For her default costume, she wears a [[gold crown]], [[flower earrings]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[yellow dress]] and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[high heels]].

title: princess_daisy_(swimwear)_(mario_kart_tour)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Daisy]] introduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. She wears a [[yellow one-piece swimsuit|yellow]] [[two-tone one-piece swimsuit|and]] [[orange one-piece swimsuit|orange]] [[frilled one-piece swimsuit]] with her usual brooch in the middle, as well as trading her crown for a [[striped bow|striped]] [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[two-tone bow|and]] [[orange bow|orange]] [[hair bow]] and a pair of [[orange footwear|orange]] [[sandals]].

title: princess_peach
body:
Lead female character of the [[mario (series)|Mario series]].

Princess of the Mushroom Kingdom, frequent damsel in distress kidnapped by [[Bowser]] and rescued by [[Mario]].

Originally known outside of Japan as "Princess Toadstool", until in 1993 "Peach" appeared in the game [i]Yoshi's Safari[/i], then in 1997 was primarily used in the game [[Mario Kart 64]].

h4. Official Art

* !post #7952714
