title: albion_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. The White Dragon of Welsh mythology. In the greater Fate universe, Albion is known for attempting to dig their way to the Reverse Side of the World, and perished doing so. The Mage's Association built the Clock Tower over Albion's remains.

[b]Huge spoilers below for Lostbelt no. 6: Fairy Realm of the Round Table, [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]].[/b]
[spoiler]Albion is the true identity of [[melusine (fate)|Melusine (Fairy Knight Lancelot)]], who was created from the dying dragon's left hand. The party has to defeat Melusine after she transforms into a black version of Albion.[/spoiler]

title: fetal_movement
body: Fetal movement, often referred to as quickening, refers to the movements of a fetus (unborn baby) felt by the pregnant woman. These movements are a sign that the fetus is developing and is a vital part of monitoring fetal health. Feeling baby move can be a sign of good health and well-being.

title: barghest_(fate)
body:
A hellhound fairy Saber-class Servant introduced in the Britain Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Despite her initial introductory title as Fairy Knight Gawain, she is not a genderbent version of [[Gawain (fate)|]].

In comparison to other female servants, she is [[tall female|unusually tall]], standing 10cm (4 inches) above Gawain himself at 190cm (6'3) and weighing 120kg (265lbs) due to her very [[muscular female|muscular build]] and [[huge breasts]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Melon22]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Marina]]

body:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with a single [[orange hair|orange]] [[streaked hair|streak]], an [[ahoge]] and [[blue eyes]]. 

Usually, she's shown wearing a variant of Kanato's [[Fura Kanato (1st costume)|Default costume]]: a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck]] [[shirt]] with [[detached sleeves]] worn underneath an [[open coat|open]] [[white coat|white]] [[two-sided coat]], a [[purple belt]], [[black skirt]], and a pair of [[black boots]] with [[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[ribbed thighhighs]].

title: pear_shaped_figure
body:
A female body type commonly seen on [[petite]] and [[shortstack]] characters, with [[wide hips|hips wider than their bust]], resembling the shape of a pear. Sometimes also called a triangle body type. Usually a package deal with [[narrow waist]] and [[thick thighs]]. Most often also paired with a [[flat chest]] or [[small breasts]] for further accentuation through contrast, though this is not required so long as the hips are noticeably wider than the bust.

If the width of the bust and hips are about equal, it's likely a [[curvy|hourglass]] figure, not a pear.

h4. Examples

* !post #8236970
* !post #5364479

h4. See also

* [[curvy]]
* [[petite]]
* [[plump]]
* [[thick thighs]]

title: ifrit_(arknights)
body:
[i]Ifrit, former test subject of Rhine Lab, will incinerate all of Silence's enemies.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Unknown[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 22[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td][[demon girl|Sarkaz]][/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former experimental test subject from [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]]. After [[silence_(arknights)|Olivia Silence]] defected from Rhine Lab, she brought Ifrit with her to Rhodes Island. Due to the experiments performed on her, she is suffering from a serious case of Oripathy. Currently, she is receiving treatment at Rhodes Island, with Silence serving as her guardian. She uses a flamethrower as her weapon of choice.

As a Sarkaz, her motif is based on devils. Her callsign is named after the mythical demon from Arabic mythology.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hanamori Yumiri]].

h4. Costumes

* !post #3827781: [[Ifrit (children's_party) (arknights)| Children's Party.]]
* !post #6270468: Lone Trail event appearance.

title: morgan_le_fay_(fate)
body:
The [[fate (series)|Fate series]]' interpretation of Morgan le Fay, [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|Artoria]]'s sister and [[Mordred (fate)|]]'s mother. Morgan appears very similar to Artoria, but wears a black crown with a black veil, and a black dress.

She is introduced as a playable Berserker-class Servant in the 6th Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]], Fairy Realm of the Round Table: [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]], [spoiler]where she serves as the Lostbelt Queen[/spoiler].

body:
A unit in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]. It is based around a family of five.

title: twitching
body:
Motions that are sudden, involuntary, sharp movements in response to agitation or stimulation. See [[flinch]] for similar motions in response to surprise or shock.

Use for momentary motions, not for sustained motions like shivering or [[trembling]].

Usually denoted by jagged [[motion lines]] or the moving body part having a jagged outline. May be [[animated]] without these techniques.

For the website, see [[twitch.tv|Twitch]].

h4. Specific Tags

* [[twitching bulge]]
* [[twitching penis]]
* [[twitching pussy]]
* [[twitching testicles]]

h4. See also
* [[flinch]]
* [[shaking]]
* [[trembling]]

h4. External Definition

"The Free Dictionary":[https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/twitch]

body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Ike Eveland]].

In his original Luxiem attire, he wears a [[turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] covered with a [[white jacket]] and a [[blue capelet|blue]] and [[white capelet]] on his top half. On the bottom half he wears a [[white pants]] with a [[suspenders]] and a [[brown belt]] on. He wears a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]], a [[blue scarf]] around his neck, a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fishnet gloves]] on his hands and a pair of [[hoop earrings]] on his ears. He also has a [[book]] attached to a [[pouch]] strap.

body:
A pointed, crown-like symbol drawn next to a character's head to represent [[surprised|surprise]], understanding or shock.  Depending on the style, it may have the appearance of a [[crown]], a series of hash marks or some variation thereof. Usually there are three points, though there is some variation. 

Not to be confused with [[notice lines]], which look more like three lines pointing outward: [code]\|/[/code].

h4. Examples

* !post #6609344
* !post #5402618
* !post #7358025

h4. Non-examples

* !post #5083438: [[notice lines]]
* !post #2016353: [[+++]]
* !post #3741758: jagged [[motion lines]] portraying [[twitching]]
* !post #8810063: wavy [[motion lines]] portraying [[trembling]]

title: galatea_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Akihabara Explosion!]] event. The statue carved of ivory by Pygmalion of Cyprus. He fell in love with his creation and prayed for it to come to life. [[Aphrodite (fate)|]] responded and animated the statue, then united them in marriage. [spoiler]In actuality, Aphrodite was only able to create life by putting a fragment of herself into the statue, resulting in Galatea having some goddess-level abilities and attributes.[/spoiler]

title: nijisanji
body:
[b]Nijisanji[/b] is a face-tracking app and [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] group, managed by Anycolor Inc. (formerly named Ichikara Inc.). The company began activities in early 2018, originally as an app developer with no intention of management (legend saying that at one time management had fewer people than their talent, before Mito exploded in popularity and necessitated more staff). The project was helmed by CEO [[Tazumi Riku]] and then-COO Iwanaga Taiki, the latter having since departed from the company.

While the app has no release date, and early on wasn't even approved by Apple, it is actively used by [i]Nijisanji Project[/i], a group of official [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]s referred to as "Virtual Livers".

Their characters are notably in 2D, instead of the initially more popular and established trend of 3D. This strategy was to minimize upfront investment and allow themselves a broader range of personalities. While some of the more popular characters do also have 3D models, 2D is still used for most appearances.

Many of the characters have alternate variations, such as [[official alternate costume|alternate costume]]s, [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]], accessories like [[kemonomimi mode|kemonomimi]], or even [[aged up]] forms. 

The official website offers a short profile for each character; however, the talent is given the freedom to develop their characters as they wish. As a result, few if any actually resemble their original profile. 

h4. Nijisanji Project members 

Initially grouping was done according to the time of debut and the nature of contract, but after 2019 these distinctions were removed and all members placed under [i]Nijisanji Project[/i]. This list represents their origins.

h5. Nijisanji

Debut: February 7, 2018

h6. First wave

* [[Tsukino Mito]]
* [[Shizuka Rin]]
* [[Higuchi Kaede]]
* [[Moira (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Elu (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Yuuki Chihiro]] (retired January 31, 2024)
* [[Suzuya Aki]] (retired August 31, 2024)
* [[Shibuya Hajime]]

h6. Second wave

Debut: Early March 2018

* [[Kenmochi Touya]]

h5. Nijisanji Gamers 

First debut: May 2, 2018. A group specializing in [[video game]] [[livestream|streaming]], aiming to bridge the gap between the audiences for [[virtual YouTuber]]s and professional gaming. Membership included both professional and casual oriented gamers, however, and activities still involved traditional Liver content such as chatting streams and singing videos. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

* [[Kanae (Nijisanji)|]]

h5. Nijisanji SEEDs

First debut: June 3, 2018. A group based on a "challenge framework with the potential for group activities." Its members were selected for variety, rather than experience or skill. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

h4. Nijisanji, China (二次三次, 彩虹社)

Nijisanji's Chinese branch. Most of these members focus their content on Chinese language platforms. 

h5. Nijisanji VTuber Project (二次三次虚拟主播企划) / [[VEgo]]

The original branch, auditions starting on July 17, 2018, and starting from August 24, 2018. It consisted of two parts, one based in Shanghai and the other in Taipei. By the end of March 2019, Nijisanji Shanghai had been deprecated, and on March 29, the branches stopped using the name 'Nijisanji', collectively changing their name to VEgo. VEgo later went inactive on March 31, 2020. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h5. [[VirtuaReal]]

The current Chinese branch, established in collaboration with Bilibili, with auditions starting April 19, 2019, officially starting beginning from May 14, 2019. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h4. Sister projects

* [[Yumenographia]] - service from the same company

* [[AniMare]] and [[Honey Strap]] - sister projects co-founded by (but not controlled by) Anycolor

* Nijisanji NetWORK - a partnership program aimed at supporting virtual talent; lasted from May 10 to December 31, 2019, only members were [[Tenkai Tsukasa]] and [[Fairys (vtuber)|]]

* [[Virtual Talent Academy]] - Anycolor's VTuber Trainee Program, announced on June 18, 2021, and soft-debuted November 1; has so far produced [[Ranunculus (nijisanji)|]], [[VOLTACTION]], [[Idios]], Usami Rito and Saiki Ittetsu (members of Oriens), Koyanagi Rou and Hoshirube Sho (members of Dytica), [[Mitarashi-dan]], Kitami Yusei and Sakaki Ness (members of 3SKM), Shiga Riko, Kisara, and Kozue Mone (members of Ayakaki)

title: kume_(touhou)
body: One of [[Ibaraki Kasen]]'s pet birds and her secondary means of transport, first seen in her manga [[Wild and Horned Hermit]]. She is a massive dapeng (commonly known as a roc in western myth), a giant sea eagle cryptid, able to carry her master's weight and at least one other passenger. Not to be confused with [[Kanda (touhou)|]], Kasen's other pet eagle, who is much more normal in size.

body: [[Ibaraki Kasen]]'s pet [[tiger]]. He is employed as a guard for Kasen's home and fights at her side in [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko
body:
先代博麗の巫女 ([i]Sendai Hakurei no Miko[/i], "The previous generation's Hakurei shrine maiden")

This tag is a catch-all for various [[Touhou]] [[Original]] Characters depicted as [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]]'s predecessor. The [[sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(m.u.g.e.n)|most famous version]] and original source of the name being a fanmade [[M.U.G.E.N]] character by MUGEN author Pre-to.

She is usually depicted as Reimu's mother, though as a fan character her relation to Reimu on the Hakurei family tree can change with each depiction.

A very popular fanwork featuring [[sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(osana_reimu)|another version]] of this character is [[Osana Reimu]] and its sequel [[Reireimu]], a story about Sendai Miko, a young Reimu, and an [[EX-Rumia|adult]] [[Rumia]].

She is not the canon character revealed at the end of [[Foul Detective Satori]]. For that character, use the tag [[Gensokyo's First Hakurei Miko]].

title: zashiki-warashi
body:
From Obakemono:

"A household spirit resembling a child of either gender from about three to twelve years of age. The name zashiki-warashi comes from the interior of Iwate Prefecture, but similar legends are found all over Japan. It is often said that when this being dwells in a house, its family will be prosperous, but when it leaves, the house will fall into ruin, and also that the zashiki-warashi is never seen, save for just as it is about to leave. Its presence however, is often marked by the mischief it does to sleeping people, such as moving pillows about and pulling on bedding."

h4. External links

* http://www.obakemono.com/obake/zashikiwarashi/

title: rokurokubi
body:
A [[traditional youkai]] (usually a cursed human woman) that is able to stretch its neck to great lengths. Tag is also for pictures containing elongated necks.

h4.  See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: otoroshi
body:
"Children's [[traditional youkai]] books often describe the otoroshi as dwelling on top of the gates to temples and shrines, waiting for impious and evil-intentioned people to pass below so that it may pounce upon them. This behavior seems to stem from a fictional account in Yamada Norio's 1974 book Tōhoku Kaidan no Tabi, and was likely inspired by Toriyama Sekien's depiction of the beast perched atop a torii gate with a bird in its claw." [1] 

h4. External links

* [1] http://www.obakemono.com/obake/otoroshi/ 
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/おとろし

title: traditional_youkai
body:
A class of preternatural creatures in Japanese folklore. Since many copyrights have elements based on mythology, only use this tag for classical depictions of the youkai. An anime girl that is stated to be a youkai and only has barely noticeable connections to said youkai does not get this tag, unless the youkai is humanoid to begin with.

Notable characteristics are: humans (transformed), shapeshifters, animals, ogres, and even inanimate objects.

title: nuribotoke
body:
"The Nuribotoke is an animated corpse with darkened skin and dangling eyeballs in Japanese mythology. They are portrayed as similar in appearance to the Buddha but with largely bloated stomachs and occasionally having a catfish's tail. They are believed to have revived due to poor care of the household shrine. However due to interpretations that they possess a tail, it may be that the corpse is controlled by another being or be a [[traditional youkai]] in disguise. It will act like a messenger of the Buddha but give out false prophecies to fool worshipers. It is also believed to dance often, more so during the demons' night parade (Hyakki Yakō)." [1]

h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia (English)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuppepp%C5%8D
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A1%97%E4%BB%8F

title: brand_of_sacrifice
body: The Brand of Sacrifice is the symbol of the Godhand in [[Berserk]], and marks those chosen to be sacrificed. The Brand acts as a beacon for ravenous demons who want to eat the bearer alive, and it bleeds and causes pain whenever they draw near. [[Guts (berserk)|]] has his Brand on the back of his neck, while [[Casca (berserk)|]] has hers on her left breast. The two are the only known characters of the series to have survived being branded.

title: nue
body:
A legendary creature found in Japanese folklore. It is described as having the head of a [[monkey]], the body of a [[tanuki]] (Japanese raccoon dog), the legs of a [[tiger]], and a [[snake]] as a tail. 

h4. See also

* [[chimera]]
* [[Houjuu Nue]], a [[Touhou]] character named after the nue.

title: noppera-bou
body:

title: nuppefuhofu
body:
ぬっぺふほふ  (also ぬっぺっぽう) 
A nuppefuhofu (also nuppeppou) is "a [[traditional youkai]] that is genderless and estimated to be up to 1.5m in height. It is described to have a flabby appearance and its appearance is accompanied by a pungent body odor. It appears as a blob of flesh with a hint of a face in the folds of fat. It is also described as having fingers and toes that are vaguely defined lumps. 

"The Nuppeppō is passive and unaggressive. The body odor is said to rival that smell of rotting flesh. Other theories claim that the Nuppeppō is actually decaying flesh. There is a rumor that states that those who eat the flesh of a Nuppeppō shall have eternal youth." [1]


h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia (English)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuppepp%C5%8D

title: mokumokuren
body:
"Mokumokuren are spirits that live in torn [[shouji]] (Japanese paper sliding walls). If the shouji has many holes, eyes can sometimes be seen on it, which, if looked at long enough, can make people blind. The only way to remove the spirit from the wall is to patch up the holes in it." [1]

body:
From "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ittan-momen :

"Ittan-momen (一反木綿 'one bolt(tan) of cotton'?) is a [[Tsukumogami]] formed from a roll of cotton in Japanese myth. Most has been handed down to the Kagoshima Osumi district. The Ittan-momen 'flies through the air at night' and 'attacks humans, often by wrapping around their faces to smother them.'"

title: help:artists
body:
The "artist library":[/artists] is a specialized database on Danbooru that serves both as a resource for artist homepages, and also as a way to determine the artist of an upload by parsing the URL it came from.

Making an artist entry can be a bit of a tricky endeavor, so this wiki should explain how to go about it.

h4. What are artists?

An artist in Danbooru represents the person who created a piece of art. Danbooru's artist database tracks extra information about artists, including the websites they use and alternate names they're known under.

h4. How do artist entries differ from tags?

For starters, artist entries list all websites or artist profiles that are associated with the artist. Danbooru uses these URLs to automatically identify the artist tag for new uploads, so it's very important to include this information.

Artists can also have multiple "other" names associated with them. Typically this includes the artist's Japanese name. Notes allow one to list other extraneous details.

Artist entries are also used to organize artists that are part of doujin circles. A circle is represented as an artist entry that has multiple group members.

h4. How to find an artist's name

On most art sites, the artist's name should be prominently displayed somewhere on their profile or alongside the post the art comes from. For smaller sites like an artist's home page or blog, information usually come in "about", "profile", "info", "link", "プロファイル", "インフォ", "アバウト", or "管理人" page. The artist's name may appear after "PN", "HN", "管理人", "名前", etc. Their circle or site name may appear after "サイト名" or "HP".

Many Japanese artists will give their name in kanji, which may make it difficult to romanize. Sites like "Tangorin":[http://tangorin.com/names/] can offer assistance with this. If there are multiple readings given, try to see if there is a connection between one of them and the artist's pixiv or Twitter username, site name or link, or email address. If you can't figure it out, you can ask in topic #8199 and someone will be able to offer you help.

If the artist's name is in kana, you can romanize their name yourself using the tables on Wikipedia for "hiragana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiragana] or "katakana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katakana]. [[howto:romanize]] contains Danbooru's guidelines on romanization.

If the tag name you want to use already exists, you must qualify it with the artist's group name or handle from a site.

h4. How do I search for artists?

Start at the "index":/artists. In addition to browsing through the entire artist list, you can also search for artist by name or by URL.

By default, Danbooru will search across names, other names, and group names using exact string matching. You can do wildcard searching with "*". For example, searching for "bol*" will return any artist whose name starts with "bol".

If you only want to search the name field, prefix your query with [i]name:[/i] like [i]name:john.[/i] [i]group:[/i] and [i]other:[/i] work similarly.

Suppose you know the artist's homepage, but can't figure out their name. Simply search for the URL (beginning with http) and Danbooru will return any associated artists.

h4. What is a banned artist?

Artists may request that all their works to be removed from the site. When this happens, the artist is marked as banned. New uploads by a banned artist will be taken down automatically.

See [[banned artist]] for the full list of banned artists.

h4. Are artists tied to tags?

No. If you create an artist-typed tag, a corresponding artist is not automatically created. If you create an artist but no corresponding tag, searching for posts by that artist won't return any results.

You can think of the artist database as separate from the tags database.

This is an intentional design decision. By keeping the two separated, users have far more freedom when it comes to creating aliases, groups, and edits.

h4. When I search for a URL, I get a bunch of unrelated results. What's going on?

Short answer: this is just a side-effect of the way Danbooru searches URLs. Multiple results typically mean Danbooru couldn't find the artist.

Long answer: when you're searching for a URL, typically it's a URL to an image on the artist's site. If this is a new image, querying this will obviously return no results.

So what Danbooru does is progressively chop off directories from the URL. http://site.com/a/b/c.jpg becomes http://site.com/a/b becomes http://site.com/a becomes http://site.com. It keeps doing this until a match is found. Danbooru does this more than once because there are cases where the URL is nested by date, like in http://site.com/2007/06/05/image.jpg. Usually this algorithm works very well, provided the artist has an entry in the database.

If they do not, then the algorithm is probably going to cut the URL down to just the domain, e.g. http://geocities.co.jp. When this happens, you'll sometimes get every artist hosted on that domain.

Why not just dump all the results if you get more than one? Well, there are a few cases when multiple artists validly map to the same domain. Usually the domain is just being used to host files or something.

h4. Is there an API?

Yes. The artist controller uses the same interface as the rest of Danbooru. See the [[help:api|API documentation]] for details.

h4. How to make an artist entry

Ideally this should be done before you tag and post the art, as creating an artist entry will automatically create an associated artist tag and allows automatically fetching the artist from a source post. 

To create an entry, you can either go to the "new artist page":[/artists/new] under the Artists tab at the top of the page, or from the upload page (The page where you're prompted to tag before clicking "Post") click the "create new artist" link under the Source tab. Using the link from the upload page will automatically populate the artist entry with an artist name, other names, and URLs, if the site is supported by Danbooru. The automatically populated artist name may not be ideal, so you are free to change it to a better name as determined by the previous section.

From here, you'll see four fields. 
* [b]Name[/b] is self-explanatory.
* [b]Other Names[/b] are for any miscellaneous names or identities the artist has, separated by spaces. These are generally what you should add in this field:

** Names in kanji
** Names in kana
** Site name
** Circle name
** Pixiv nickname (Found under Pixiv avatar)
** Pixiv username (Found in the Pixiv stacc feed URL)
** Twitter name
** Usernames or handles from any other site

* [b]Group[/b] is usually the circle name. Only one group name is supported, as commas and spaces are considered part of the name. Unlike tag names, the group name supports any characters and thus you should use the original spelling and stylization of the name, including CJK characters, asterisks, and capitalization.

* The [b]URLs[/b] field is a list of URLs associated with the artist, like their home page, their blog, and any servers that store the artist's images. Separate URLs with newlines or spaces.

If you've created a general (blue) tag by mistake, you have to change it to an artist tag before Danbooru will allow you to make an artist entry with that name. To do that, you can simple prefix the tag name with [code]art:[/code] or [code]artist:[/code] from the tag edit field on the post it's tagged on, or by finding it on the "tags listing":[/tags], clicking the triplet dot dropdown menu and clicking "Edit". Note that you should not do this for existing tags, only ones you have created as the wrong category by mistake.

h4. Editing artist entries
If you want to supply additional URLs, Other names, or update the Group name- You can do so from the "/posts/":[/posts?tags=danboorubot] page, clicking "Artist" next to "Posts", and clicking "Edit artist", or by accessing the entry from "/artists/":[/artists/532525] and clicking "Edit" under the sub-tabs (Or "Edit artist" below the list of URLs).
[b]Do not remove dead URLs.[/b] See topic #8048 for the many reasons why you should leave them alone. Instead, prefix the URL with a - to mark it as dead.
If you think the presently assigned name is unsuitable, consider going to the "Artist alias request thread":[/forum_topics/7713] and submitting an alias request. You can also manually edit the name of the artist entry under the Name field, [b]but it is preferred to alias[/b], as this will simultaneously update all tagged posts to the new name.

h4. Wikis
A wiki can exist for an artist, but must be created from "the new Wiki page":[/wiki_pages/new]. This is typically only reserved for important details such as requests not to merge with any alt artist entries, or if the entry is for a commissioner/reposter of some kind. Wikis for artists should not contain any of the URLs associated, to avoid any redundancy.

h4. See also

* "Table of Contents":[/help/toc]
* Using Pixiv: [[howto:pixiv]]

title: looks_to_the_moon
body:
Looks to the Moon (aka. "Big Sis Moon") is a character from [[Rain World]].  She is an [[Iterator (Rain World)|]], and is the one with the most interaction with the player. Her superstructure has collapsed into the sea, putting most of her systems offline and with only her puppet and 6 neuron flies keeping her alive.

Her puppet has [[colored skin]] in the range of [[blue skin|blue]] to [[green skin|green]], a [[forehead mark|red circle on her forehead]], and [[robot ears]] resembling antennae. She may be depicted wearing an orange-brown [[robe]], a tattered white robe, or nothing.

title: nerissa_ravencroft
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of the third generation of [[hololive english]] [[holoadvent|-Advent-]]. She describes herself as a Demon of Sound and a lover of idols. Designed by [[Kim Eb]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]], [[large breasts]], [[uneven horns]] (canonically she had one of her horns broken to reduce her power) decorated with small [[horn flower|flowers]], and [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[low wings]]. Her default hairstyle is [[swept bangs]] with [[sidelocks]] decorated with a small [[tassel hair ornament]] tied into a [[flower knot]].

title: caren_hortensia_(amor_caren)_(third_ascension)
body: [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]] in her Third Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]], known as [b]God Caren[/b]. She gains a pair of black curly horns, and wears a heart choker, a black highleg striped leotard beneath a purple corset, black thighhighs, and black shoes. Her [[Caren Hortensia (Devil Caren)|Devil Caren]] costume is a recolor of this ascension.

title: caren_hortensia_(amor_caren)_(second_ascension)
body: [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]] in her Second Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]], known as [b]Caren C Hortensia[/b]. She wears a red hat, a red blouse, a red skirt, black pantyhose, and red shoes. She has the [[Shroud of Magdalene]] floating around her arms.
other_names: カレン・C・オルテンシア

title: caren_hortensia_(amor_caren)_(first_ascension)
body: [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]] in her First Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She has a small heart on the top of her head, and wears a short white Greek dress and black sandals.

title: divorce
body:
When a character shows a bill of divorce, dissolving an existing marriage with their spouse.

title: soren_(fire_emblem)
body:
A mage from the [[Fire Emblem]] series. Called Senerio in the Japanese version.

Remarkably, he ended in the Top 2 of the 2023's edition of "Choose Your Legends":https://vote7.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en_us (men's side), making him the first non-lead character from an old-school Fire Emblem (Pre-Awakening) to become a Brave Hero.

title: gweon_sua
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A Korean librarian and book-lover who is forced to take part in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She has an exceptional photographic memory that allows her to remember anything she's read perfectly.

Has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] with [[shamrock]] [[clover-shaped pupils]], and [[huge breasts]].

title: exhaust
body:
Expulsion of [[gas]] or air from a machine, such as the engine of a [[vehicle]].

[b]Not to be confused with being physically [[exhausted]].[/b]

title: golden_generation_(umamusume)
body:
A grouping of five [[horse girl]]s which in [[Umamusume]], based on real life, were three year olds in [[1998]] and could potentially participate in the classics of that year (note: As the Japanese horse racing industry used the traditional age counting until [[2000]], contemporary sources would have referred to them as four year olds). 
h4. Members
* !post #7607693: [[El Condor Pasa (umamusume)|]]
* !post #7607710: [[Grass Wonder (umamusume)|]]
* !post #7608536: [[King Halo (umamusume)|]]
* !post #7607802: [[Seiun Sky (umamusume)|]]
* !post #6097893: [[Special Week (umamusume)|]]
* !post #8741491: [[Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi (umamusume)|]] [tn](Implemented later)[/tn]

Posts should use this tag only if at least the core five members appear in the post and are the focus. [b]Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi[/b] is technically optional as she was implemented later but more recent images usually include her.

title: miwa_shirow
body:
Male Japanese mangaka and illustrator. He created the manga [[DOGS: Bullets & Carnage]] which has been turned into an anime OVA and also did the artwork for [[7th Dragon 2020]]. He also illustrated the official artwork for the video game series [[No More Heroes]] and [[Puzzle & Dragons]] (designing [[Sakuya (p&d)|]] and Sandalphon), as well as guest artwork for [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. He also is one of the illustrators for [[supercell (band)|]]. He likes drawing fanart for various other works, Japanese and Western alike. His favorite music includes [[Nine Inch Nails]] and Rammstein.

h4. Works
* [[7th Dragon 2020]]

title: jam_(umamusume)
body:
A team of three [[horse girl]]s from [[Umamusume]]. In real life, the three shared the three crowns that make up the Triple Crown of thoroughbred horse racing in [[2001]].

This tag should only be used when all of these characters appear in a post:

* !post #7711605: [[Jungle Pocket (umamusume)|]] - 2001 Japanese Derby winner
* !post #7608153: [[Agnes Tachyon (umamusume)|]] - 2001 Satsuki Sho winner
* !post #7607900: [[Manhattan Cafe (umamusume)|]] - 2001 Kikuka Sho winner
* !post #7913734: [[Dantsu Flame (umamusume)|]]  - [tn]Competed with JAM in the 2001 Classics[/tn]

[b]Dantsu Flame[/b] is an honorary member because she frequently competed with the other three, as well as having a large role in the movie, [[Umamusume: Beginning of a New Era]]. For this reason, some works will feature the acronym "JDAM" as well.

h4.Examples

* !post #7349481
* !post #7054925

title: hokko_tarumae_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

Tomakomai's very own idol horse girl. She is named after Mount Tarumae, a nearby volcano. Part of the Dirt Trio, she is usually depicted as the most level-headed member of the trio, having to rein in Copano Rickey's Feng Shui evangelism as well as Wonder Acute's granny tendencies. However, she's still a very enthusiastic evangelist of her hometown, being it's Tourism Ambassador. She is often depicted with many things pertaining to Tomakomai, such as [[haskap|haskap berries]] and fellow city mascot [[Tomachop]].

h4. Appearance

title: matikane_tannhauser_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

A bubbly yet surpisingly normal girl with a long name and a cute catchphrase. Due to her clumsiness or poor luck, she often get nosebleeds. "Machitan" is a member of Team Canopus in the anime, being effectively the optimistic klutz of the team. She is also take notes in her efforts to become better.

h4. Appearance

title: rice_shower_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. She's a [[horse girl]] with a gothic theme. Rice Shower, as well as [[rice_shower_(racehorse)|the original horse]], are named after the tradition of throwing rice at weddings for good luck. She's the member of Team Sirius in the game.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown_hair|brown]] [[flipped hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair_over_one_eye|covering her right eye]] decorated with a [[tilted_headwear|tilted]] [[blue_hat|dark blue hat]] and [[purple eyes]].

title: cheval_grand_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A tomboyish middle child with a complex about her talented [[Verxina (umamusume)|older]] and [[Vivlos (umamusume)|younger]] siblings.

title: vivlos_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. She first appeared in the third season of the anime.

A cute but flirty young lady who wants to race at [[Dubai]]. She is the youngest of [[V sisters|three talented sisters]], the other two being [[Verxina (umamusume)|]] and [[Cheval Grand (umamusume)|]].

 Her impish nature is displayed by her constant [[:3|cat mouth]]. She calls her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] "Traicchi" ([b]トレっち[/b]), which follows how she nicknames those she is particularly affectionate with (i.e. [[Cheval Grand (umamusume)|"Chevacchi"]]).

title: houjou_mutsumi
body:
[[Keroro Gunsou]] character; called Saburo Mutsumi in the anime adaption. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He is usually depicted in the [[Kissho Academy school uniform]], and often wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[beanie]].

h4. Official art
* !asset #23404573

h4. Trivia
* "Mutsumi" can be read as "623". He uses this string of numbers as his moniker for the radio show he hosts and DJs.
* In the manga, this alias is "326".
* He is often seen with [[Kururu (keroro gunsou)|]], the only character to know his secret DJ identity.
* He is voiced by [[Ishida Akira (voice actor)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Keroro Gunsou characters]]

title: kubota_miyu
body:

title: loves_only_you_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. Voiced by [[Kubota Miyu|]].

A streamer horse girl with a large fanclub, she runs to bring love to fans around the world while being supported by the same fans with their own love.

Her [[two-tone hair|unusual hair colors]] [[split-color hair|(and partition of said colors)]] represents the hood the real horse wore as part of the Yahagi stable.

title: nigekiri_sisters_(umamusume)
body:
Three-person [s]idol[/s] "umadol" unit from [[Umamusume]]. Consists of the members [[Smart Falcon (Umamusume)|]], [[Silence Suzuka (Umamusume)|]] and [[Mihono Bourbon (Umamusume)|]], with Falcon leading the group. Later on expanded to five members with [[Ines Fujin (Umamusume)|]] and [[Maruzensky (Umamusume)|]] joining the Sisters.

All five members of the group specialize in the "runner" (nigekiri) pacing strategy during uma races, hence the name. The name of the group is sometimes translated as "Runaway Sisters" here on Danbooru.

The Sisters have their own [[idol clothes|'uniform' outfit]] consisting of a pink-and-white striped [[sleeveless dress]] with a yellow bodice-skirt (resembling a miniature tutu) worn on top. They also wear the Umamusume [[starting future (umamusume)|]] in their performances.


h4. Members

* !post #6804063: [[Ines Fujin (Umamusume)|]]
* !post #7607617: [[Maruzensky (Umamusume)|]]
* !post #7607885: [[Mihono Bourbon (Umamusume)|]]
* !post #7607689: [[Silence Suzuka (Umamusume)|]] 
* !post #7608245: [[Smart Falcon (Umamusume)|]] [tn]- leader and founder[/tn]

title: giltia_lu_dorud
body:
A main heroine from [[Motto! Haramase! Honoo no Oppai Isekai Oppai Bunny Gakuen!]]. 

A second year at Lepus Rabirio Bunny Academy. She has a [[purple_hair|purple]] [[bob cut]] hairstyle with [[pink_hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Her hair also [[hair_over_one_eye|covers one eye]].  She is a [[succubus]] who tries to fight the urges of her race and remain decent. A [[tsundere]]. Like all students at her school, she dresses as a [[Playboy Bunny]] and has [[huge breasts]]. She is a member of the Lepus Rabirio Healthy Public Morals Committee. Due to wanting to seem less erotic, she uses magic to makes her breasts [[small_breasts|small]]; though this spell becomes undone when she is aroused.

Her mother is Savene Lu Dorud.

Height: 158 cm (5' 2")
Bust: 129 cm (U Cup)
Waist: 56 cm
Hip: 85 cm
other_names: ギルティア・ル・ドルード

title: howto:pixiv
body:
"Pixiv":[https://www.pixiv.net] is a website where Japanese artists upload their artwork. It's one of the main sources of images on Danbooru.

h4. Uploading

Paste the link to the Pixiv post on the "upload page":[/uploads/new]. Don't download the image to your computer then upload it. Pasting a link avoids uploading a [[Pixiv sample]].

h4. Artist tags

If the artist doesn't already have a tag, then you'll need to make one. To create a new artist tag, tag the post with [code]artist:tag_name[/code].

The tag name should normally be their Pixiv display name in romanized form. See [[howto:romanize]] or ask in topic #8199 if you need help coming up with a tag name.

After you make a new artist tag, click the '?' next to the tag in the tag list to create a new artist entry. In the artist entry, add:

* The artist's Pixiv URL (e.g. https://www.pixiv.net/users/1007080)
* The artist's name (found under their profile picture).
* Any other names or URLs listed in their profile.

See [[help:artists]] for more information about making artist tags.

h4. Searching

When searching by tag, Pixiv has a limit of 1000 pages for results. To bypass this limit, add [b]?ecd=YYYY-MM-DD[/b] to the end of the URL:

* https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/ガールズ%26パンツァー/artworks?ecd=2016-06-08

h4. See also

* [[pixiv sample]]
* [[bad pixiv id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[ugoira]]

title: artist_request
body:
A request for the artist of a post.

Do not use this tag if there is a source available, such as the artist's homepage, blog, Pixiv, etc. Read [[Help:Artists]] and create a new artist tag yourself, or ask for help in topic #8199: Artist tagging help.

It might be possible to find the artist with the help of a Reverse Image Search engine (see [[Help:Image source]]).

h4. See also

* [[source request]]
* [[tagme]]

title: howto:tag
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Rule of Thumb":[#dtext-rule-of-thumb]
* "Minimal Tagging Criteria":[#dtext-minimal-tagging-criteria]
* "General Tags":[#dtext-general-tags]
** "Commonly Blacklisted Tags":[#dtext-blacklisted-tags]
* "Missing Information":[#dtext-missing-information]
* "Using the Related Tags Features":[#dtext-using-related-tags]
** "Related Tags":[#dtext-related-tags]
** "Related Artists":[#dtext-related-artists]
** "Related Characters":[#dtext-related-characters]
** "Related Copyrights":[#dtext-related-copyrights]
** "Find Artist":[#dtext-find-artist]
** "Favorite Tags":[#dtext-favorite-tags]
** "Beware of Limitations":[#dtext-limitations]
* "Tag Consistency and Integrity":[#dtext-tag-consistency]
** "Use Danbooru's Existing Tags":[#dtext-use-existing-tags]
* "Creating a New Tag":[#dtext-tag-creation]
* "See Also":[#dtext-see-also]
* "Further Reading":[#dtext-further-reading]
[/expand]

Tagging is the second most important job on [[danbooru (site)|Danbooru]], and should be done meticulously.

By tagging an image with [b]keywords which describe the content[/b], users are able to search for images featuring a specific character or theme. Detailed and specialized tagging is what made Danbooru become an anime-art [i]database[/i], instead of just a huge collection only good enough for casual browsing.

Users at "Member":[/wiki_pages/43574] level can be invited to become "Builder":[/wiki_pages/43574] when their prominent tagging efforts are noticed. 
([tn]See "Help:Users#Getting_Promoted":[/wiki_pages/43574] for more information.[/tn])

If you have any trouble or issue with tagging, please create a thread in the "Forum":/forum_topics to ask, or consider using an already existing tag help thread.
[quote]
[b]Existing tag help threads:[/b]

* [b]How do I tag this?[/b] (topic #12251) is for help on tagging things specifically.
* [b]Wiki Requests[/b] (topic #12858) is for questions on the definition of a tag. 
[/quote]

h4#rule_of_thumb. Rule of Thumb

[b]Tag what you see, not what you know[/b]. In other words, only tag [b]the visual and factual elements in the image[/b]. For example, images where the full moon is prominently depicted will have a [[full_moon]] tag. Ideally you should use an existing tag on Danbooru.
This means you should not tag what you know about a character.  For example [[Remilia Scarlet]] is supposed to be a vampire, but don't tag every picture depicting her with the [[vampire]] tag. Only use the vampire tag if the characteristics are clearly visible. 

[b]Do not[/b] use [[tag_group:subjective|subjective tags]] (such as sexy, cute, hot, etc.). These tags are problematic because they are based on personal opinion, and different opinions can conflict. Images based on a subjective theme can be collected into a pool instead.

Examples of pools for subjective themes:

* pool #1636: Fund It!
* pool #1908: What has science done?!?

Please consult [[help:pools]] for more information on creating pools.

h4#minimal_tagging_criteria. Minimal Tagging Criteria

[b]Artist.[/b] See [[help:artists]] for more information.

[b]Character.[/b] All featured characters must be positively identified.
* See [[howto:character]]

[b]Copyright.[/b] Indicate from which series the characters came from.
* The [[original]] tag is used for art that is not based on any established works (anime, game, manga, movie).
* See [[howto:copyright]]

[b]Source.[/b] The original URL the image was taken from must be provided. If there's no URL, indicate by words from where the material came from (i.e. name of the artbook, name of doujinshi, imageboard, [[scan]] etc)

[b]Rating.[/b] Sexual material must be indicated according to [[howto:rate]].

[b]Spoilers.[/b] Some images are spoilers themselves, and must be declared with the [[spoilers]] tag.

h4#general_tags. General Tags

Describing the image in simple keywords - What objects are in the image ([[gun]], [[jacket]], etc.)? Is there a particular theme to the image (is it [[Christmas]]? Is there a [[war]]? etc.)?

Remember: There are a lot users who are not familiar with a character or a copyright, so using the following basic tags will enable those without such knowledge to recognize and search for images easily:

* Character's features: hair length, hair color, hair style, decorations on head ([[hat]], [[hair_ornament]], [[hair_ribbon]], etc.), eyes color, and recognizable special attributes.
* Expression: [[frown]], [[sad]], [[smile]], [[shy]] etc.
* Actions: see [[tag group:posture]].
* Objects: [[book]], [[cloud]], [[gun]], [[pen]], [[teacup]], etc.
* Time of day: [[day]], [[evening]], [[morning]], [[night]], [[twilight]], etc.
* Sexual content: see [[tag group:sex acts]].

Please consult [[tag groups]] for more ideas. See also [[list of commonly misused tags]].

h6#blacklisted_tags. Commonly Blacklisted Tags

The following must be tagged to allow viewers to blacklist images on demand:
* [[Furry]]
* [[Guro]]
* [[Loli]], [[Shota]] (see topic #8650)
* [[Peeing]], more commonly known as 'urination'.
* [[Rape]]
* [[Scat]], more commonly known as 'feces' or 'shit'.
* [[Spoilers]]. Repeated, due to its importance.
* [[Vomit]]
* [[Yaoi]], [[Male Focus]]

h4#missing_information. Missing Information

[[Source_request]], if the source of the image (URL) is not known.

[[Tagme]]*, if anything else (including copyright) is not known. This includes items and weapons characters are seen wielding, or exotic accessories they are wearing. [b]Do not intentionally use[/b] [[tagme]] as an excuse for being too lazy to tag own uploads. 

h4#using_related_tags. Using the Related Tags Features

[quote]
[b]Note:[/b] This part of the guide only applies to the built-in tag editor on the Post Full View. If you are using DanbooruUp or any third party tools, please also consult the tools' own documentation for help.
[/quote]

Danbooru's Related Tags features are a great help at finding suitable candidates among the tens of thousands of tags already in use on Danbooru. If, for example, you are having some difficulty coming up with a new tag for the likes of that seemingly exotic accessory that character is wearing on her forearm, Related Tags may help you find the tag you have been looking for.

When you call on one of the Related Tags features, you will get a list of commonly accompanying tags for the tag that the cursor is currently on. It will also list the tags that are linked from its wiki page.

Add related tags by clicking on a tag from the lists that appear. Tags that have been added will be highlighted in blue. Clicking on a highlighted tag removes the tag from the image.

h6#related_tags. Related Tags

For the tag that your cursor is currently on, you will get a list of tags which commonly accompany it.

Consider the tag [[witch]]. Calling on Related Tags will reveal that images with [[witch]] also tend to contain [[broom]], [[ribbon]], [[witch_hat]], and [[dress]]. Owing to the fact that the black witch [[Kirisame_Marisa]], a character from [[Touhou]] is very heavily featured on Danbooru's collection, both tags will also appear on the list.

h6#related_artists. Related Artists

For the tag that your cursor is currently on, you will get only [[artist:]] tags which commonly accompany it. This feature might find limited use most of the time, as uploaders should have identified the artist when they uploaded the image.

However, it gives an insight to what artists have drawn on. Consider the [[Hatsune_Miku]] tag. Calling on Related Artists will show the artists with a high amount of Hatsune Miku fanart in their portfolio, as far as Danbooru is concerned.

Another use of [[artist:]] tags, to check on other artists who have participated in collaborations.

h6#related_characters. Related Characters

For the tag that your cursor is currently on, you will get only [[character:]] tags which commonly accompany it. This is intended to be used with [[copyright:]] tags. Consider the tag [[K-On!]] (full: [[copyright:K-On!]]). The list for [[K-On!]] will mostly feature names of characters from [[K-On!]].

Beware that characters from other copyrights may creep up into this list. This happens because there is a considerable number of [[crossover]] [[K-On!]] art. Verify this with this search {{K-On! crossover}}. 

h6#related_copyrights. Related Copyrights

For the tag that your cursor is currently on, you will get only [[copyright:]] tags that commonly accompany it. This is intended to be used with [[character:]] tags. Consider the infamous miko with detached sleeves, [[Hakurei_Reimu]]. Calling on related copyrights will list [[Touhou]] related copyrights, and crossovers featuring [[Touhou]] characters.

h6#find_artist. Find Artist

This feature is intended to check your [[artist:]] tags
and verify if they have been previously featured on Danbooru. However, due to limitations, this feature may not work correctly. You may find using the related artist feature more reliable. Check if artist names have been highlighted.

h6#favorite_tags. Favorite Tags

This is a list of tags which have been entered into your [b]Uploaded Tags[/b] list in you Settings screen under your [b]My Account[/b] control panel.

h6#limitations. Beware of Limitations

The Related Tags lists are arranged alphabetically, instead of by relevance, or by number of posts. This may cause complete confusion to taggers who are completely new to the copyright or characters featured on the image they have just uploaded.

For this reason, it is always advisable to research copyrights and the associated characters before tagging.

h4#tag-consistency. Tag Consistency and Integrity

Please double-check your tags on the left side of the screen after applying them. If you have any tags with a total count of 1, a new tag has been created. Often, tag creation on Danbooru is not necessary. If this happens, please check that your tags have been correctly spelled.

To ensure that your tags are correctly spelled, it is best to pick your tags from the Related Tags lists, as doing this automatically enters the tags for you.

h6#use_existing_tags. Use Danbooru's Existing Tags

Please use Danbooru's existing tags whenever possible, but do create a new tag if you are sure that it is not covered by existing tags or pools. If you aren't sure about which tag to use, don't be afraid to ask on the forums. Danbooru most often uses the original language's title when naming copyrights and characters, so always double check. See [[howto:copyright]] and [[howto:romanize]] for details.

h4#tag_creation. Creating a New Tag

Only ASCII characters are permitted in tag names. Tags must be romanized if they're coming from Japanese or another language that uses non-ASCII characters. See [[howto:romanize]] for details.

h6. Name restrictions

Tag names carry several restrictions, either for technical reasons or simplicity:
* Tags cannot contain non-ASCII characters. This includes Japanese letters. Replace them with their appropriate [[howto:romanize|romanization]] if necessary.
* Tags cannot contain asterisks. They are used as a wildcard in searches.
* Tags cannot contain spaces. Replace them with underscores instead, as spaces are used to delimit tags.
* Tags cannot contain commas.
* Tags cannot end with an underscore.
* Tags cannot contain consecutive underscores.
* Tags cannot contain unprintable characters.
* Tags cannot exceed 170 characters in length.

h6. Tag types

* [b]Artist[/b] names carry the prefix ''artist:'' or ''art:''
* [b]Character[/b] names carry the prefix ''character:'' or ''char:''
* [b]Copyright[/b] titles carry the prefix ''copyright:'' or ''copy:''
* [b]Meta[/b] tags carry the prefix ''meta:''
* [b]General[/b] tags are normally not prefixed at all, because all tags without a prefix are by default automatically assumed to be ''general:'' or ''gen:''


h6. Naming a tag
[b]Use singular nouns.[/b] This especially concerns tags about objects which appear multiple times in an image. Under all circumstances, use the [b]singular[/b] for the object. If an image contains a bin full of [[wispberries]], tag it [[wispberry]]. This greatly simplifies searching and tagging.

[b]Resolving Ambiguities with Qualifiers.[/b] If the tag you are going to use had already been taken up for another purpose (other character with the same name, character with the same name as an object, character and series have the same name, etc.), add a qualifier between () to distinguish them.

For example Black Rock Shooter is both the OVA name and the female protagonist's name.

* [[Black_Rock_Shooter]] is used for the copyright.
* [[Black_Rock_Shooter_(character)]] is used to indicate the female protagonist.

See [[help:qualifiers]] for further reading.

[b]New Character Tags.[/b] Always use the character's full name in your tags. Name order should appear the same as in the original materials. Commonly:
* SurName_FirstName for Asians. Example: [[Shameimaru_Aya]], where Shameimaru is her surname.
* FirstName_SurName for Westerners, and most other ethnicities. Example: [[Ken_Masters]].

h4#see_also. See Also

* [[howto:tag_checklist|Tagging Checklist]]
* [[Tag_groups|Tag Groups]]

h4#further_reading. Further Reading

* "Danbooru Legacy Help on Tags":/help/tags (Note: Obsolete, for reference purposes only)

[[howto:contribute|Return to the Contributor Guide]]
[[help:toc|Return to the Table of Contents]]
[[help:home|Return to the Wiki Help Home Page]]

title: xinjinjumin
body:
Ambiguous: xinjinjumin is the default username for Lofter accounts, similar to a default Pixiv stacc (user_*), not an actual name. Create your new artist entry with the proper artist name (see [[help:artists]] or ask in topic #8199 if you need help) and add your posts to that new tag instead.

See "xinjinjumin*":[/artists?search%5Bany_name_matches%5D=xinjinjumin%2A&search%5Border%5D=created_at] for a list of artists who are still using the default Lofter username.

title: howto:wiki
body:
The Danbooru Wiki exists to provide information about topics relevant to the site. Primarily, wiki entries are used to explain the usage of the various tags given to posts. In addition, the wiki allows us to construct useful informational resources such as tag lists, tag groups, and "How To" pages such as the one you are currently viewing. 

This page will give you an idea of how to properly construct or edit an entry in the Danbooru Wiki, as well as some warnings regarding what conduct is unacceptable. As with all things, if you have further questions about the material presented here, you may ask a staff member or contributor for help. Most of us are glad to help you. 

If you accidentally create a non-relevant wiki page, you may delete it by clicking "Edit" and then clicking "Delete".

h4. Formatting

All wiki pages are formatted using "DText":/static/dtext_help.

h4. Style

Use "h4." for headers and "h5." for subheaders. Character names should be written in the same order as their corresponding tag.

h4. Images
Images can be added to wiki pages. For more information on images, see topic #26714.

To add a group of thumbnail images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1
* !post #2
* !post #3
[/code]
To add captions beneath the images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1: This is a caption.
* !post #2: Here's another caption.
* !post #3: Captions can contain links, like this: [[Touhou]].
[/code]
To add a single large image to a wiki (do this only for things like screenshots in help wikis, not tag wikis), write this:
[code]
!post #1
[/code]
To add an arbitrary image that isn't from a post, first upload it, then find it on the Media Assets page, then write this:
[code]
* !asset #19734342: [[Ford Mustang II]] (1973-1978)
[/code]

h4. Guidelines

h5. What NOT to do:

* [b]No spoilers.[/b] The wiki is not the place to give away plot information. If spoilers are [i]absolutely necessary[/i] in order to describe the basis of a [[meme]] or other tag, it [b]MUST[/b] be marked properly [code][spoiler][/code] like this [code][/spoiler][/code] to make it [spoilers]like this[/spoilers].
* [b]Do not make entries for nonexistent tags[/b], except to mark a tag as [[list of disambiguation pages|ambiguous]] or [[tag group:subjective|subjective]]. Do not make entries for characters or copyrights that don't have any posts. Do not make vanity entries for yourself or for other users. There are some exceptions for rules articles such as this one, or explanatory categories such as [[tag_groups]].
* [b]Do not be subjective or biased.[/b] Wikis should be purely objective. Your personal feelings on the issue do not belong. Do not use words like "stupid", "sexy", "annoying", or "awesome".
* [b]Do not create wiki entries without a proper understanding of the tag and its correct usage.[/b] A misleading wiki giving incorrect information to users does not help the site in any way.

h5. What to do:

* [b]Be concise.[/b] Provide only the basic information that someone unfamiliar with the subject needs to know. As a rule of thumb, avoid going beyond one to two short paragraphs. If possible, especially regarding characters and copyrights, provide a link to an outside website with further information for the benefit of those interested.
* [b]Be relevant.[/b] Only include information that is relevant to Danbooru. The main purpose of a wiki entry is to explain how a tag is used, not to list everything you know about the topic.
* [b]Use images that are as safe-for-work as possible.[/b] Blacklists currently don't apply to embedded images, so they should be safe for everybody. For NSFW wikis, at least choose images that are tasteful. 
* [b]Link to other wiki entries.[/b] When you mention another tag, don't forget to link to that tag's wiki entry.
* [b]List other relevant links.[/b] Put links to any other relevant tags or outside websites in a "[b]See also[/b]" section at the bottom of the entry.

h5. Character wiki guidelines:

* [b]List the copyright.[/b] Don't forget to mention which copyright the character is from.
* [b]Describe the character's appearance.[/b] Be descriptive enough that someone unfamiliar with the character will be able to recognize and tag that character.
* [b]List the character's name in kanji/kana.[/b] This is helpful for translators.
* [b]Use correct naming conventions.[/b] Characters are tagged in the way they are written in their native languages, thus [[kinomoto_sakura|Kinomoto Sakura]], not Sakura Kinomoto. This "original order" policy carries over from tagging into wiki writing as well as translation notes.
* [b]List other relevant tags.[/b] Be sure to list any other tags that relate to the character. These may include alternate versions of the character, [[genderswap|genderswaps]], [[parody|parodies]], and so on.

h5. Copyright wiki guidelines:

* [b]Provide a brief synopsis.[/b] A short synopsis to provide some context is helpful, but [b]do not[/b] describe the plot in detail and [b]do not[/b] provide spoilers.
* [b]List related characters.[/b] List any characters that are involved in the copyright. Do not list characters that don't have any posts. 
* [b]List related copyrights.[/b] List any related sequels, prequels, or spin-offs.
* [b]Refer to series using the name Danbooru uses.[/b] For example, use [[hayate_no_gotoku!|Hayate no Gotoku!]] in a wiki, not Hayate the Combat Butler. It may be appropriate to mention alternate or translated titles, but use our tag as the primary. Don't italicize the name.

h5. Artist wiki guidelines:

* [b]Don't create unnecessary pages.[/b] For artist tags, there is the "artist library":/artist. See [[help:artists|how to use]].
* [b]Create pages without duplicating information.[/b] Sometimes it is required to specify additional information, then a wiki-page of the same name is created for the tag. Don't write a list of links and alternative names or nicknames. Use the artist library. 

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Wiki":/wiki_pages/help%3Atoc#dtext-wiki
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home
