title: help:home
body:
h4. Welcome to the Danbooru Wiki Help!

[quote]
Danbooru [dahn-boh-ruh] ([i]noun[/i]):
1. ([i]on donmai.us[/i]) A repository of high-quality anime-style art and doujinshi.
2. A taggable imageboard, with sophisticated features for keeping, organizing and finding pictures.
3. ([i]Japanese[/i]) Corrugated cardboard box.
[/quote]


h5. Rules

Please familiarize yourself with the [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]], [[help:community rules|Community Rules]] and the "Terms of Service":[/terms_of_service]. All users are obliged to follow these rules for everyone's benefit. 

h5. Guide

Searching [b]([[help:cheatsheet|Search Cheat Sheet]])[/b]
Posts [b]([[help:upload|Uploading Guidelines]] | [[howto:rate|Rating Guidelines]] | [[help:post_relationships|Parent and Child Posts]])[/b]
Tags [b]([[howto:tag|Tagging Guidelines]] | [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]] | [[Tag Groups]])[/b]
Users [b]([[help:users|User Levels]])[/b]
Pools [b]([[help:pools|Pool Guidelines]] | [[Pool Groups]])[/b]
Moderation [b]([[about:mod_queue|Moderation Queue]] | [[howto:flag|Flagging Posts]] | [[howto:appeal|Appealing Posts]] | [[about:upload_limits|Upload Limits]] | [[help:user_records|Issuing User Records]]) [/b]
Notes [b]([[howto:Translate|Translations]] | [[about:note_formatting|Note Formatting]])[/b]
Artists [b]([[Help:Artists|Artists]] | [[howto:pixiv|Pixiv Artists]]) ("Banned Artists":[/artists/banned])[/b]
Wiki [b]([[howto:wiki|Writing Wiki Entries]] | [[List of Meta-Wikis]]) [/b]
Userscripts [b]([[about:userscripts]])[/b]
Custom CSS [b]([[about:custom css style]])[/b]
DText [b]([[help:dtext|DText Cheat Sheet]])[/b]

h5. Contributors: HELP WANTED

Posts [b]({{image_sample}} | {{md5_mismatch}} | {{source_request}} | {{bad_source}} | {{source:none}})[/b]
Tags [b]("list of deprecated tags":/tags?commit=Search&search%5Bhide_empty%5D=yes&search%5Bis_deprecated%5D=yes&search%5Border%5D=date | {{tagme}} | {{character_request}} | {{copyright_request}} | {{artist_request}})[/b]
Translations [b]({{translation_request}} | {{partially_translated}} | {{check_translation}})[/b]
Commentary Translations [b]({{commentary_request}} | {{partial_commentary}} | {{check_commentary}})[/b]
Other Information [b]({{source_request}} | {{annotation_request}} | {{clothing_request}} | {{flower_request}} | {{weapon_request}} | {{food_request}})[/b]
Upload Bounty Thread: topic #24186
Shinjidude's Tasks to Do: topic #5076

h4. Information for Lurkers and New Users

h5. [[howto:get_started|Getting Started: Danbooru New Lurkers Guide!]]

New to Danbooru and the concept of our site? This primer is for you. It contains an introduction to browsing and searching, and some of the features of a basic account. It will take about an hour to finish.

h5. [[help:glossary|Glossary of Terms]]

Familiarize yourself with some of the lingo used by members. Also great as a recap for long-time users.

h5. [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide (Becoming a Contributor)]]

Lurked long enough? Want to help out? This guide introduces you to the things you need to know to become a contributor!


h4. More Help?

h5. [[help:toc|Danbooru Help Table of Contents]]
The Table of Contents is the ultimate list of Help pages and Tutorials.

h5. [[help:frequently_asked_questions|Frequently Asked Questions]]
A page that strives to answer your frequent questions about uploading posts, the tagging system, and user levels.

h5. [[List of Meta-Wikis]]
See the list of meta-wikis for the full list of tag groups, character lists, and help and howto pages.

title: help:upload
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Danbooru Quality: Posting Guidelines":[#dtext-danbooru-quality-posting-guidelines]
** "Rules":[#dtext-rules]
** "Err on The Side of Caution":[#dtext-err-on-the-side-of-caution]
** "Danbooru is Subjective":[#dtext-danbooru-is-subjective]
* "Uploading":[#dtext-uploading]
** "Source Your Upload":[#dtext-source-your-upload]
** "Minimal Tagging Criteria":[#dtext-minimal-tagging-criteria]
** "Make Use of Comments, Discord and the Forum":[#dtext-make-use-of-comments-and-the-forum]
** "Check for Duplicates":[#dtext-check-for-duplicates]
* "See Also":[#dtext-see-also]
[/expand]

h4#danbooru_quality_posting_guidelines. Danbooru Quality: Posting Guidelines

Thank you for donating your spare time to help the Danbooru collection grow. While we need a constant supply of new images to keep our collection fresh and up to date, we must make it clear that Danbooru has stricter quality standards compared to most galleries of its kind.

Before you upload your first image, please keep in mind that not everything you upload might be approved. 
While we understand that quality can be an extremely subjective measure, and we cannot exactly define what "good enough" means, you can browse the gallery of approved posts to get an idea of what is acceptable. You can see those posts here: {{status:active approver:any}}. 
Generally, posts with [[bad anatomy]] or a lot of [[JPEG artifacts]], or very [[lowres|low resolution]] will have a hard time getting approved, while competently drawn images will be approved fairly quickly. 
Posts depicting very niche fetishes like [[inflation]] might also have a hard time, because they appeal to very few users, so the bar for that kind of post might be higher than average.

The upload rules (see below) go into detail on what is considered risky content. Refer to that page for more info.


h5#rules. READ THE "UPLOAD RULES":/help/upload_rules BEFORE PROCEEDING

The rules describe what is forbidden and what is conditionally accepted. Please read them before you upload.


h5#err_on_the_side_of_caution. Err on The Side of Caution

If unsure about an image meeting our quality standards, you can ask in the "Official Discord":https://discord.gg/danbooru.

h5#danbooru_is_subjective. Danbooru is Subjective

We know that it can seem unfair at times that we judge images on quality, which is of course a subjective value. But we do this because this method works for Danbooru and pleases the majority of the userbase. Don't take it personal if one or more of your uploads don't get approved. We've all been there, just live and learn. Details on how to appeal deletions that you see as unfair are on the [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeals page]].

h4#uploading. Uploading

To upload a post, simply either paste the link into the "upload page":[/uploads/new], use the "bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or the "web extension":[https://github.com/danbooru/upload-to-danbooru]. Many of the most popular art sites are supported natively by Danbooru, so all it takes is pasting a link into the upload page. "See here":/static/bookmarklet for a list of supported sites.

Try not to upload images from sources that aren't from the original artist or a [[second-party source]] (official accounts for a game or anime in case of [[official art]], or a commissioner, etc), and always look for an [[help:image source|original source]] whenever possible. Sites such as 4chan, Reddit, or Facebook are not ideal places to source your image, unless the artist posted their art there or has long deleted their original post.

h5#source_your_upload. Source Your Upload

[b]See [[help:image_source]] for a complete help page on how to source your uploads.[/b] Sourcing images is especially important on Danbooru for both archiving and tracking purposes.

[b]Sourcing is NOT optional if your upload is not self-provided. Source your uploads as best as you can.[/b]

h5#minimal_tagging_criteria. Minimal Tagging Criteria

Comprehensive tagging is of the essence on Danbooru, [[unlimited blade works (reality marble)|its body and its blood]]. However, in cases where it is not yet possible to comprehensively tag an image as we would like, we have a minimum criteria for tagging new posts:

* Characters must be identified by name in the tags.
** Use the [[original]] tag if it's an original character.
** Place a [[character_request]] if you aren't sure where a character comes from.
* Artists must be credited. Read [[help:artists]] for more information.
** Uploads must have at least an artist: tag
* Copyrights which a character is from must be identified.
** Place a [[copyright_request]] if you cannot surely identify it.
* Major body characteristics of characters must be identified. Be sure to include:
** [[tag group:hair styles|Hair styles]]
** [[tag group:hair color|Hair colors]]
** [[tag group:eyes tags|Eye colors]]
** [[tag group:attire|What the characters are wearing]]
* If you are not sure if an image is tagged completely enough, always place a [[tagme]] tag, and another contributor will review your tags, adding and making corrections as necessary. Do not frequently use [[tagme]] as an excuse for being too lazy to tag own uploads.

For Tagging Guidelines in greater detail, please see [[howto:tag]] and [[howto:tag_checklist]].

h5#make_use_of_comments_and_the_forum. Make Use of Comments, Discord and the Forum

Most of the time, a cursory trip to Google will help you accomplish most things such as finding out which copyright a character comes from. If you have an issue that where Google research just wouldn't do, please leave a comment on the image about the issue you want to clarify, or ask in the "Official Discord":https://discord.gg/danbooru or in the forums.

Also, please read the [[howto:comment|Commenting Guidelines]] to get an understanding about commenting on Danbooru.

h5#check_for_duplicates. Check for Duplicates

Be sure that your post has not been uploaded by someone else. When uploading an image, a list of similar images will appear at the bottom of the page.

If your image has already been uploaded, only upload if you have a higher quality copy. Once you have uploaded your higher quality copy, set all existing copies of the image as child posts of your copy.
Bigger size doesn't necessarily mean better quality, unless the filesizes vastly differ. For example, if one image is 800 kb and another is 840 kb, it's very likely they'll be [[duplicate]]s. Always check the images closely before uploading if you're unsure.

For more information on setting Parent and Child Posts, refer to the chapter on [[help:post_relationships|Managing Parent and Child Posts]] in the Contributor's Guide.

h4#see_also. See Also

* [[about:mod_queue|Moderation Queue]]
* [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeals]]
* [[help:upload_rules|Upload Rules]]


[[howto:contribute|Return to the Contributor Guide]]
[[help:toc|Return to the Table of Contents]]
[[help:home|Return to the Wiki Help Home Page]]

title: howto:twitter
body:
"Twitter":[https://twitter.com] is where a growing number of Japanese artists publish their works. It's one of the main sources of images on Danbooru.

[b]Note:[/b] Japanese artists may refer to Twitter using the half-width ﾋ character, since it resembles how Twitter's logo used to look.

h4. Uploading

To upload from Twitter, paste a link to the tweet on the "upload page":[/uploads/new], like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://twitter.com/weirdlilguys/status/1755223245614150080

Don't paste a direct link to the image, like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GFvOPQpW0AAR0A4.jpg

If you paste a direct link to the image, then Danbooru won't be able to find which tweet it belongs to, and won't be able to pull the artist, tags, and commentary.

h4. Image quality

Since December 11th, 2019, Twitter won't compress or downscale images unless the image is bigger than 4096x4096, more than 5MB large, or it has [[exif rotation]] or very inefficient compression ("[1]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204557498990002176], "[2]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204842518208057344]).

This means that Twitter uploads usually have the same quality as Pixiv uploads.

Images posted before December 11th, 2019 were always compressed or downscaled (except for PNG with alpha channel), so Twitter images from this time period were generally lower quality than Pixiv images.

h4. Artists

When making an artist entry, add both the username and user ID profile URLs, like this:

* http://twitter.com/GK0322
* http://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=12345678

Danbooru will usually fill in both URLs automatically when making a new artist entry. If if doesn't, then you can use https://tweeterid.com to determine a user's Twitter ID, or use the following bookmarklet:

[expand=Bookmarklet to show ID]
[code]
javascript:(() => {prompt('Twitter ID', `https://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=${JSON.parse(document.querySelector(%27script[data-testid=%22UserProfileSchema-test%22]%27)?.textContent)?.author?.identifier}`)})()
[/code]
[/expand]

See [[help:artists]] for more information about artist entries.

h4. See also

* [[bad twitter id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[twitter sample]]

title: howto:contribute
body:
h4. Lurker to Contributor Transformation Guide

Lurked long enough and want to start posting something? If you have just made an account, it would be a good idea to make sure you know the rules and content guidelines before submitting anything.

Please keep in mind that [b]everything you submit is a contribution[/b], from comments and tag edits to uploads and translations. Everything you do here should be about the content of the site and making it better.

h4#howto:danbooru. How to Danbooru

These rules apply to every part of our site:
* "Terms of Service":/static/terms_of_service ("Terms")
** "Upload Rules":/help/upload_rules
** "Community Rules":/help/community_rules

It would be good to know how Danbooru works:
* [[howto:get_started|The Lurker Guide]], if you haven't done so.
* "Search cheatsheet":/help/cheatsheet
* "DText cheatsheet":/static/dtext_help

h4. Tags

Want to help out with adding tags to posts? You are about to take part in one of Danbooru's most important efforts. Therefore you should know the tagging standards we expect from you.
* Check out high-scoring posts (search: {{score:>50}}), as those tend to be the best tagged posts on site, and some not-so-good tagging (search: {{tagme}}).
* Read the [[howto:tag|Tagging Guidelines]]. Know the guidelines for creating new tags.
* Check out the [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]], our measure of tagging quality on Danbooru.
* Learn how to use the "Tag Search":[/tags]

Also know the process of creating new tags:
* Only create new tags when absolutely necessary
* Creating [[howto:copyright|Copyright Tags]]
* Creating [[howto:character|Character Tags]]
* Using [[help:qualifiers|Qualifiers]] (those things in the parentheses).


h4. Posts (Uploading)

Posts are the blood and bone of Danbooru. We pride ourselves for having the best picture collection on the internet, and we expect you to maintain the standard. Before you upload anything, we would like you to:
* Read the Upload Rules. See "How to Danbooru":#dtext-howto:danbooru above.
* Know the upload [[about:mod_queue|Moderation Process]]

Useful places:
* [[about:mod_queue]] and the [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeal]] process.
* Upload feedback thread (topic #7934).

More Protips:
* Remember to tag what you upload. All new posts are expected to be tagged to at least Level 1 per the [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]].
* It is a good idea to learn how to tag (see above) before uploading.

h4. Rating 

Please help out by making sure that all posts are properly rated. This is required for "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe] to work properly.

* Read the [[howto:rate|Rating Guidelines]] for rating sexual content.
* Extreme violence or depictions of body mutilation must be tagged with the [[guro]] tag.

Just to get into the right kind of thinking:
* Posts with a general rating ({{rating:g}}) would be things you could show to someone in public.
* Posts with a sensitive rating ({{rating:s}}) would be things you will be comfortable viewing in art class in high school.
* donmai.moe only displays posts with a rating of general. Improper rating may cause donmai.moe to show posts not wanted there.

h4. Comments

Do you have something to say about a post that you have seen? Before posting a comment on any post, make sure you have read the "community rules":[/help/community_rules].
Remember that you can use the [b]No bump[/b] option when posting follow-up comments. Your use of non-bumping is very much appreciated.

h4. Forum

Before posting on the forum, make sure you have read the [[help:community rules|Community Rules]].
The Forums are [b]only[/b] for issues concerning content (like posts, and tags), Danbooru bugs and suggestions. Nothing personal should be posted. 
See also topic #8235: Useful threads index.

h4. Pools

Do you think some posts you have been browsing should be in a pool? Check out:
* Our [[help:pools|Pool Guidelines]]
* The Pointless Pools Forum (topic #8282), where pools are reported for deletion. Reading the posts in there will give you an idea of how not to create a pool.
* Examples of good use for pools: 4koma Manga Series (pool #678), Untaggable Theme (pool #1886)
* A discussion on Pools That Should Be Tags (topic #8956).


h4. Translation Notes

Here's what you need to know before placing notes on a post:
* [[help:notes|Note guidelines]].
* [[about:note_formatting|CSS and HTML formatting in notes]].

h4. Artists

If you are helping mantain the Artist database, check out the [[help:artists|Danbooru Artist Guidelines]]


h4. Wiki

If you would like to contribute to the wiki, please make sure you:
* Have read the [[howto:wiki|Wiki Quality Guidelines]]
* Know about the Pointless Wikis thread (topic #7690)

[b]Thanks for Contributing![/b]

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Information for Lurkers and New Users":/wiki_pages/help:toc.html#dtext-information_for_lurkers_and_new_users
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: help:translated_tags
body:
Names used for this tag on other sites such as Pixiv. Danbooru can compare the Other Name entries with the tags listed on the external site and list the corresponding Danbooru tags under a "translated" column in the Related Tags section when uploading.

h4. Setting up a tag

In order for the translated tags feature to work for a tag, the tag's wiki page must have the corresponding names from external sites set. To set these, find the tag's wiki page and go to edit it. If it doesn't have a wiki, create one. In the [b]Other names[/b] field, put the name(s) that other sites use for this tag, separated by spaces.

For example, the [[original]] wiki has オリジナル in its Other names, because オリジナル is the Japanese term for original works and is used on sites such as Pixiv.

h4. Using translated tags

In order to use translated tags when uploading, you should use the "official upload bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet. If you do, the site will automatically fetch data from the source you're uploading from, and then provide a list of translated tags in the Related Tags section under "translated", which you can click to add each one.

If you're not using the bookmarklet to upload, you can instead manually click "Fetch source data" (you must first put the source URL in the Source field). You can use the same "Fetch source data" link to use translated tags on a post that has already been uploaded, in the Edit section. However, this method doesn't work with all sites that the bookmarklet does.

Currently, sites that work with translated tags are: Pixiv, Nico Seiga, and Nijie (bookmarklet only).

h4. What to put in the wiki Other names field

* Character and copyright names in other languages.
* General tags used on other sites only if they correspond exactly to a tag on Danbooru.

Be careful not to add names that sound similar, but in practice are used very differently on other sites.

h4. What Not to put in the wiki Other names field

* An artist's other names. These should go in the artist entry's other names field instead of the wiki's. There is also an artist finder which automatically suggests the correct artist for a post which works separately from translated tags. See [[help:artists]] for more details.

title: help:qualifiers
body:
Qualifiers are those things in parenthesis you see at the end of some tags. They serve to make the exact meaning of the tag clear so there is no confusion with other tags.

There are many types of qualifiers.

h4. Artist qualifiers

Many artists go by a short name that can be shared by other artists or characters. So Danbooru qualifies them with another text string that is related to that artist. It may be:

* the artist's website or blog name
* circle name
* The username (often different from their actual displayed name) that artist uses on a site like Pixiv, Twitter, DeviantART, Tinami, etc.
* Nickname

Examples: [[shimo_(depthbomb)]] / [[aile_(crossroads)]] / [[alphonse_(white_datura)]]

See [[help:artists]] for more info.

h4. Series Qualifiers

For names of characters that can be confused with characters from other series, or with artists. If the series name is long, an abbreviation may be used for the qualifier.

Examples: [[yamada_maya_(infinite_stratos)]] / [[knight_(ragnarok_online)]] / [[araya_(nakaimo)]] / [[angel_(evangelion)]]

h4. Cosplay Qualifier

[[hatsune_miku_(cosplay)]] automatically adds both [[hatsune_miku]] and [[cosplay]] to a post.

h4. Meme Qualifier

[[longcat_(meme)]] automatically adds [[meme]] to a post.

h4. Distinguishing copyrights from characters or objects

[[metroid]] = The game series
[[metroid_(creature)]] = The alien creatures from the series

[[claymore_(series)]] = The manga and anime series.
[[claymore_(sword)]] = A type of sword, which the manga was named after.

h4. Alternate forms of characters

Examples: [[hatsune_miku_(append)]] / [[saigyouji_yuyuko_(living)]]

title: howto:pawoo
body:
"Pawoo":https://pawoo.net/ is an instance of "Mastodon":https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon run by [[Pixiv]] Inc. It is best known as an alternative to [[Twitter]] for posting NSFW art, especially [[loli]], [[shota]], and [[toddlercon]].

On pawoo (and other instances of Mastodon), 'tweets' are referred to as 'toots', 'likes' are referred to as 'favorites' and 'retweets' are referred to as 'boosts'.

This page will describe how to sign up and upload from Pawoo, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Word of caution

Uploading from pawoo is unadvised for a few reasons:

* All jpg images are resampled (albeit at a lower rate than Twitter)
* All images are currently configured to be resized to a maximum of 1280x1280, much smaller than what Twitter allows.

You should always look for a better image source off another site such as pixiv or nicoseiga if it is available ([[help:image source]]).

h4. Signing up

Pawoo will not allow you to view links to the timeline if you do not have an account. That includes links like these:

* https://pawoo.net/web/accounts/8525
* https://pawoo.net/web/statuses/33721

The interface now has an English interface that also allows you to sign up with your pixiv account, so signing up should be fairly straightforward.

h4. Uploading

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the toot URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet. The link to a toot should look something like this:

* https://pawoo.net/@maaya/33721

It's important to note that the HTML URL to the toot is much more preferred than that of the direct image URL to the tweet for various reasons. Artist information and commentary, for example, are readily available to pull from the image source if the tweet has not been taken down yet.

The upload page will [b]NOT[/b] always correct your source to the HTML link for you. Remember to correct it yourself when it so happens.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them, or correct their artist entry if they have changed their twitter handle.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If the source is not fixed after your upload has completed, you will have to fix it yourself.

h4. Artist entries

Most pawoo users will have a pixiv account, usually listed somewhere in their profile. If not that, they they may also have a twitter account to reference. In cases like these, see [[howto:pixiv]] or [[howto:twitter]]. Remember to add new Pawoo account URLs to their artist entries if they exist.

If none can be found, see [[help:artists]] for how to romanize their name and add a new artist entry for them.

h4. See also

* topic #13941
* [[help:pawoo api|Pawoo API]]
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/}}
* {{source:https://img.pawoo.net/}} -- this should have no matches.
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/media/}} -- neither should this.

h4. External links

* "pawoo.net Source Code":https://github.com/pixiv/mastodon

title: howto:nijie
body:
Nijie is a website where a number of Japanese artists upload their works. It has a primary focus on sexually suggestive and explicit works. In addition to [[pixiv]] and [[niconico|nicoseiga]], it is another major source of images on Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from nijie, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading from Nijie.

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. Luckily, Nijie does not actually have samples in case you decide not to go this route, but it is still highly recommended. The bookmarklet works from both [code]view.php[/code] and [code]view_popup.php[/code] pages. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming

Rule of thumb is: Make a [b]simple, readable, and memorizable[/b] tag.

The first choice is to use the artist's real name if you can find it on any websites or blogs listed on their nijie profile. See [[help:artists]] for advice on finding the artist's name on their website.

Many artists also have [[pixiv]] accounts in addition to their Nijie account. Refer to [[howto:pixiv]] for more information in the case you find one.

Once you have a name, [[howto:romanize|romanize it]]. Name kanji often have several different readings, so it's best to use any available indicators (such as their twitter handle) on how to read the name. If you don't know how to read this name or are unsure of the correct reading, post in topic #8199 to ask for help.

Note that Nijie nicknames are not necessarily unique. If it is too generic ("Ken", "Daisuke", "Youko", etc.), add a qualifier to make it unique. Good choices for qualifiers include:

* The artist's circle name
** e.g. [[gurande_(g-size)]]
* The artist's twitter handle
** e.g. [[oyamada_(pi0v0jg)]]
* If nothing else exists, their nijie ID
** This is a very rare case, and should be avoided.

h5. Things to note

* [b]Do not[/b] use non-ASCII characters for the artist's name, even if they look like ASCII letters--Ｒｙｕ is not the same as Ryu. Save that for the "Other names" field.
* [b]Do not[/b] use "_(nijie)" or "_(artist)" as the qualifier. There are probably a dozen Nijie artists named Sakura or Miki, so those qualifiers are simply not effective.
* [b]Try not to[/b] make a hard to read name like [[ken_(oooxvbgj)]].

h4. Artist entries

To create or edit an artist entry, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list. In the artist entry, add:

h6. Other Names
* The artist's Nijie nickname (found under their profile picture).
* Any other account names, Twitter handles, or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs
* The Nijie profile URL: http://nijie.info/members.php?id=10543
* URLs of any other websites the artist lists in their Nijie profile.

h4. See also

* [[bad nijie id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tumblr
body:
[[Tumblr]] is a social networking website that allows users to post multimedia and other content to a short blog. It is a popular source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from Tumblr, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Uploading using either the bookmarklet or upload page will automatically retrieve the best image available. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. For more technical details, you may expand the following:

[expand]
Tumblr has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[tumblr sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here. These samples may carry one of multiple available file name suffixes: 

* [code]_75sq[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_100[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_250[/code] (sample)
* [code]_400[/code] (sample)
* [code]_500[/code] (sample; sometimes original, see forum #132817)
* [code]_500h[/code] (sample; height-bounded)
* [code]_540[/code] (sample)
* [code]_640[/code] (sample)
* [code]_1280[/code] (sample; sometimes original)

Where the original usually ends with:

* [code]_raw[/code]

In addition to these, any image that matches the following query is also a sample [i]unless[/i] it has a [b]r*[/b] (r1, r2, etc.) in the filename:

* {{source:*tumblr.com/ md5_mismatch downscaled status:active}}

post #2568503 is not a sample, for example (note the [b]r2[/b]).
[/expand]

h5. Using the bookmarklet

[b]This method is highly recommended![/b]

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If your source link isn't fixed, you should remember to fix that also.

h5. Using the "uploads":/uploads/new page

[b]1.[/b] Copy the image URL into the [b]Source[/b] box. The upload page will automatically retrieve the largest size available (typically [code]_raw[/code]), so you won't need to change it unless you wish to be extra careful. Just like above, the image URL for "this post":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608] is "this":[https://68.media.tumblr.com/8818848735da2f77be8669c45e8d3bae/tumblr_ohva67iieD1tq4vrto2_r2_1280.jpg].

[b]2.[/b] Tag your post and upload it.

[b]3.[/b] Since the upload page will not correct the source for you as there is no referrer, you must remember to correct it yourself. Just like above, the source should point to the tumblr post and look something like "this":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608].

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

[b]1.[/b]. Search for the artist Tumblr homepage URL using the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists]. It should look something like this:

* http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/

[b]2.[/b] Using the same method, search for any other URL from the artist's Tumblr profile if available, or use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's images turn up any hits for Danbooru. You may find there already exists an entry for the artist. If so, then add the artist's Tumblr URL to their artist entry and stop here. If not, follow the next step.

[b]3.[/b] Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Help:Artists]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tumblr sample]]
* [[bad tumblr id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tinami
body:
[[Tinami]] is a Japanese online community for artists. It is a minor source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from tinami, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

[b]Uploading using the "danbooru bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet is [u]currently unavailable[/u] for Tinami.[/b]

Additionally, [b]uploading using the image URL on the "uploads page":[/uploads/new] [u]will not work either[/u].[/b] This is due to an issue with Tinami that requires the HTTP Referer header to be from the Tinami domain. (See Issue #2818)

Therefore, uploading from Tinami requires downloading the image to your local machine, then uploading it using the file function from the [b]uploads page[/b].

After uploading the image, edit the source so that it points to the original post page and not the image link (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/view/1234[/nodtext][/b]).  This will make it easier to find the artist and the original post that picture came from.

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

1. Search for the artist Tinami profile URL (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext][/b]) from the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists].

2. Search for any other URL from the artist's Tinami profile using the method in [b]#1[/b] above.

3. Use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's thumbnail images turn up any hits for Danbooru. [tn][b]Note: [/b]Thumnail images do not have the same restrictions as regular image links, which is why this works[/tn]
* See [[Help:Image Source]] for more help on reverse-image search engines.
* Use thumbnail images from the artists gallery and not their profile, as the profile thumbnails get cropped.
** [b]This:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/search/list?prof_id=1234[/nodtext]
** [b]Not this:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext]

4. Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Help:Artists]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tinami sample]]
* [[bad tinami id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:deviantart
body:
[[deviantart|DeviantArt]] is a website where most Western artists upload their work. It serves as another major source of images on Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from DeviantArt, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading a DeviantArt artist:

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. For more technical details, you may expand the following:

[expand]
Upload from DeviantArt (not from your computer) with the [b]full image URL[/b] if possible. On the right side, there should be a link to the URL labeled "Download". If it's not there, zoom into the picture as much as possible and copy the image URL from there. 

Since Danbooru supports direct linking to the image URL, the source URL should look like one of the following:

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]orig[/b]10.deviantart.net/b1f7/f/2015/169/1/b/1b095k69ceedwac54177e18132g8a084-d8xbdx0.jpg
http[i]:[/i]//[b]orig[/b]09.deviantart.net/cb07/f/2015/172/f/1/k_by_sampleartist-d4kso7f.png
[/quote]

Or if the original source URL cannot be accessed for whatever reason (that is, when the download button will not be present):

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]img[/b]14.deviantart.net/2d53/i/2015/156/a/c/___sample_work___by_sampleartist-d8w7vhm.jpg
[/quote]

DeviantArt has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[deviantart sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here. Your source URL should not look like these:

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]pre[/b]03.deviantart.net/31ed/th/pre/f/2015/172/f/1/k_by_sampleartist-djy6akj.png
http[i]:[/i]//[b]pre[/b]07.deviantart.net/1a1f/th/pre/f/2015/169/1/b/1b095069ceedfacfdty177e18132b8a084-d4dudx0.jpg
[/quote]

[/expand]

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected by Danbooru under Related Tags, if there is one. If not, follow the rest of this howto to create a new artist tag.

* Do a [[help:cheatsheet|source:*username* search]] for the DeviantArt username. The username is usually found in image source URL. For example, search {{source:*shirononochiko*}} if the source URL is http[i]:[/i]//orig00.deviantart.net/e1d7/f/2013/096/7/2/nonexistent_work_by_[b]shirononochiko[/b]-gj83sbo8.png.
* If you find any posts and they already have an artist tag, use that tag. You will need to update the artist entry so that Danbooru will automatically detect the artist tag for future uploads. See [b]Artist Entries[/b] to learn how to do this.
* If this search didn't turn up any posts, or you find posts but they don't have an artist tag, then you will have to make a new artist tag yourself. Edit the post and add [b]artist:artist_name[/b] to the tags. See [b]Artist Naming[/b] for advice on choosing a name. After making a new artist tag, you will also have to create an artist entry. See [b]Artist Entries[/b] to learn how to do this.

h4. Artist Naming

The first choice is to use the artist's full real name, if you can find it. On the main profile under the artist's username, there should be a section that shows the artist's real name, gender, and location. The name should have both a first and a last name. If it's in non-English letters, follow Danbooru's [[howto:romanize|romanization guidelines]]. Otherwise, check any personal websites or blogs they may list in their DeviantArt profile. See [[howto:artist]] for advice on finding the artist's name on their website.

The second choice is their DeviantArt username.

h4. Artist Entries

After creating a new artist tag, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list to create a new artist entry. In the artist entry add:

h6. Other Names
* Any other account names, Twitter handles, or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs
* The DeviantArt profile URL: [b]h[/b][b]ttp://sampleartist.deviantart.com/[/b]
* URLs of any other websites the artist lists in their DeviantArt profile.

h4. See also

* [[deviantart sample]]
* [[bad deviantart id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

body:

DanbooruBot is not a real person, and thus can't be tagged on any posts in sincerity.

title: shizuku_no_oto
body:
[b]Shizuku no Oto[/b] (also known as [b]Sound of Drop -fall into poison-[/b]) is a game by LYCORIS.

In Tokyo's Manten Aquarium, a place shrouded in urban legends like blood-red waters on full moon nights and man-faced fish, junior high students Mayu and Himeno visit to investigate. Their fun investigation takes a dark turn when they spot a glimpse of Mayu's missing younger sister, Mari. As they pursue Mari's shadow, fate intervenes, leaving Mayu alone and lost within the eerie, crimson-tinted aquarium.

h4. External links

* "vndb: Shizuku no Oto":[https://vndb.org/v15940]
* "Steam":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/383460/Sound_of_Drop__fall_into_poison/]

title: inugami_korone
body:
An energetic [[dog girl]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]] [[hololive Gamers|Gamers]]. Designed by [[Fukahire (Ruinon)]].

Being a dog girl she has [[extra ears|both]] human and [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail]], her upper lip is shaped like a [[:3|dog mouth]] and has [[fangs]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her usual hairstyle consists of [[low twin braids]] and a [[bone hair ornament|bone-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. Her second, and specially her third costume reveal that she has surprisingly [[large breasts]] that where somewhat hidden by her regular attire.

h4. Costumes

title: panty_straps
body:
[[panties|Panty]] or [[bikini]] straps visible above the waistline of the pants or bottoms. This normally occurs with [[highleg]] or [[thong]] underwear worn high on the hips.

Do not use this tag if the straps and the front or back panel are visible together. 

If the straps and the back panel are visible from the back and create a Y-shape, use [[whale tail (clothing)|]].

title: untied_panties
body:
Panties that are [[untied]] on one or both sides. 

Tag [[untying]] and maybe [[strap pull]] if the character is in the middle of untying her panties. Do not confuse with [[holding panties]] which is for when the panties are completely [[unworn panties|removed]].



h4. See also

* [[Untying]] (for the active act of untying)
* [[Wardrobe malfunction]] (if the cause is accidental or otherwise unlooked-for)
* [[Assisted exposure]] (if the cause is through deliberate action)

title: holding_panties
body:
Holding a pair of [[unworn panties|removed panties]].

Do not confuse with [[adjusting panties]] and [[untying]] [[untied panties]] as in both cases, the panties are still on the body.

h4. See also

* [[holding bra]]
* [[presenting removed panties]]

title: artifact_(genshin_impact)
body: Items from [[Genshin Impact]] that aside from weapons, serve as a main form of increasing a character's stats. There are five main categories which generally, but not always, have the appearance of the object implied by their title: * Flower of Life (a.k.a. "the flower") * Plume of Death (a.k.a. "the feather") * Sands of Eon (a.k.a. "the clock", "the hourglass" or "the timepiece") * Goblet of Eonothem (a.k.a. "the cup") * Circlet of Logos (a.k.a. "the crown", "the hat" or "the headpiece") There are also a multitude of themed sets which grant bonuses when equipped in matching combinations. h4. See also * [[List of Genshin Impact tags]] h4. External links * "Genshin Impact Wiki: Artifact":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Artifact]

title: eotech_g33
body:
A magnifying device designed to be used in conjunction with the [[EOTech]] series of holographic sights. 
Comes with either 2X or 3X magnification.

title: eotech_exps3
body:
A compact variant of the [[EOTech]] holographic sight that is powered by CR123 rather than common AA batteries.

Distinguishable by its side-mounted controls for compatibility with magnifiers, quick-detach lever on the left side of the sight, and a button to enable or disable night-vision mode.

title: oculus_(genshin_impact)
body:
An object from [[Genshin Impact]]. Oculi are [[orb]]s containing immense elemental energy that can be collected and offered to corresponding [[Statue of the Seven|Statues of the Seven]], restoring them for rewards.

The general design has a center core with an elemental symbol orbited by two exterior decorations. The specific colors and design of the oculus varies by its element and region.

title: twisted_wonderland
body:
A Japanese mobile rhythm game created by Aniplex and Disney Japan. The game focuses on the students of Night Raven College, a magic academy consisting of "twisted" versions of classic [[Disney]] villains and franchises.

Designs by [[Toboso Yana]].

h4. Characters 

h6. Heartslabyul

* [[Riddle Rosehearts]]
* [[Ace Trappola]]
* [[Deuce Spade]]
* [[Trey Clover]]
* [[Cater Diamond]]

h6. Savanaclaw

* [[Leona Kingscholar]]
* [[Ruggie Bucchi]]
* [[Jack Howl]]

h6. Octavinelle

* [[Azul Ashengrotto]]
* [[Jade Leech]]
* [[Floyd Leech]]

h6. Scarabia

* [[Kalim Al-Asim]]

title: tubalcain_alhambra
body:
First Lieutenant Tubalcain Alhambra 《トバルカイン・アルハンブラ中尉, Tobarukain Aruhanbura Chūi》 is a major antagonist in the [[Hellsing]] series created by Kohta Hirano. He is voiced by Houchu Otsuka in the Japanese sub and Steve Wilcox in the English dub.

Otherwise known simply as "The Dandy 《伊達だて男, Dateotoko, OVA: Dandy Man》," Tubalcain is an agent of the Millennium Project who appears calculating and powerful as he issues a challenge to Alucard in [[Rio De Janeiro]]. Well dressed and well mannered, his peculiar and unique skill is that of being able to attack with a deck of [[Playing Card|Playing Cards]] whose deadly properties included such a keen sharpness they are able to slice cleanly through whatever stands in their way.

https://hellsing.fandom.com/wiki/Tubalcain_Alhambra

* !post #7838200
other_names: トバルカイン・アルハンブラ

title: schroedinger_(hellsing)
body:
[[Hellsing]] character. A Warrant Officer in Millennium and member of the Werwolf Squad. He is a [[cat boy]] with [[flipped hair|flipped]] [[blonde hair]], [[red eyes]], and an [[otoko no ko|androgynous]] appearance, who dresses in a Hitler Youth [[military uniform|uniform]]. 
He possesses the ability to be "everywhere and nowhere"; because he exists in a state of quantum uncertainty, his location and physical status are entirely determined by his own cognition, and can be altered at will.
other_names: シュレディンガー准尉

title: fn_scar_17
body:
The [b][[battle rifle]][/b] variant of the [[FN SCAR]], chambered 7.62×51mm NATO. Also known as the SCAR-H or Mk17 in the [[united states|US]] "SOCOM":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Special_Operations_Command. Distinguishable by its straight 20-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and longer barrel. The semi-auto civilian variant is dubbed "SCAR 17S".

h4. See also

* [[FN Mk 20 SSR]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: fn_mk_20_ssr
body:
The FN Mk 20 SSR (Sniper Support [[Rifle]]) is a 7.62×51mm NATO [b][[designated marksman rifle]][/b] manufactured by [[FN Herstal]], based on the [[FN SCAR 17]]. It features a non-folding adjustable buttstock with a cheek rest and an extended receiver. 

h4. See also

title: obr_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Larue Tactical OBR]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Would receive a [[OBR (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

The caliber of her OBR varies from design to design. By default and while wearing [[OBR (envoy of spring) (girls' frontline)|Envoy of Spring]], it's a [[AR-10|Larue Tactical OBR 7.62]], while in [[OBR (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|MOD3]] and wearing [[OBR (Queen of Castile) (girls' frontline)|Queen of Castile]], it's a [[AR-15|Larue Tactical OBR 5.56]].

body:
Group tag for [[Umamusume]] characters whose names start with "Sakura". All of the characters in real life were owned by "Sakura Commerce":[https://sakura-com.com/], who named every race [[horse]] they owned with names starting with "Sakura". In-game the group is referred to as the "Victory Club".

* !post #7611157: [[Sakura Laurel (umamusume)|]]

title: v_sisters
body: A group of three [[horse girl]] [[sisters]] from [[Umamusume]]. They are collectively named as such for the V (or ヴ kana) in their names. In real life, those three horses were foaled by "Halwa Sweet":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000727544/], a racemare known for having no tail except for the very end. Cheval Grand (the Chestnut colt/horse) was sired by [[Heart's Cry (racehorse)|]] and the other two (both Black mares) were sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]]. They also share retired pitcher [[Sasaki Kazuhiro]] as their owner. For their Umamusume counterparts, this is translated into all sisters sharing an interest and strong point in [[baseball]]. They also share a cowlick on their bangs (in Cheval Grand's case, it's the blaze marking) and [[blue eyes]]. Where they differ is whether or not they have [[mole under eye|a mole under an eye]] (Cheval Grand doesn't) as well as the shade of blue of their eyes (sky blue for Cheval Grand, a dark purplish blue for the mares). Their base costumes also follow the same marine theme and theme naming: Cheval Grand has "Grand Itinéraire" ("Great Itinerary"), Vivlos has "Voyage Étincelant" ("Brilliant Journey"). The tag is only applied if all THREE of them appear in the same image, either together or in the context of their own relationship if they are not together. * !post #7611174: [[Cheval Grand (umamusume)|]] - Middle Sister * !post #7611205: [[Verxina (umamusume)|]] - Older Sister * !post #7611212: [[Vivlos (umamusume)|]] - Younger Sister

title: dagobah
body: Dagobah is a fictional planet and eponymous star system appearing in the [[Star Wars]] films The Empire Strikes Back, Return of the Jedi, and Revenge of the Sith, and other media. It is depicted as a world of murky swamps, steaming bayous, and jungles, resembling Earth during the Carboniferous period. Dagobah is 14,410 kilometers in diameter with an orbital period of 341 days. Dagobah's climate and atmosphere consists of two seasons: a dry season, where the uplands become too hot for most life forms to survive; and a wet season, consisting of violent lightning storms, dense fog, and long periods of torrential rainfall. The Tash were a sentient species native to Dagobah.

title: matara_kan_(military)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Matara Kan]].

Getting ready to battle the [[momo (matara kan)|Evil Momo]], she now wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of [[black hat|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a Momo emblem on the front, a [[white jacket]] and [[white pants]], a [[black gloves|black]] [[single gauntlet|gauntlet]] with a [[gold trim]] on her left hand, [[black footwear|matching]] [[thigh boots]] with [[pink footwear|pink highlights]] on the left boot, and a [[pink cape|pink]] [[fur trim]]med [[cape]] mimicking the shape of her wings.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[very long hair|Very long]] [[pink hair]] done in a [[wolf cut]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[parted bangs]]
* [[Short hair]] with  [[short hair with long locks|locks reaching past her shoulders]]
* And she is able to go [[bald]]

h4. Appearance

title: matara_kan
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], originally debuting as part of [[VShojo]] on October 15th, 2023. Designed by [[Kenkou Cross]] and illustrated by [[Cluseller]].

VShojo parted ways with her on May 5th, 2025.

Being a [[cockroach girl]], she has [[multiple legs]] on her back. She has [[red eyes]] and for her default hairstyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[antenna hair]]. Her hair also twitches much like [[cockroach]] [[wings]] do.

title: adeptus_astartes
body:
The [b]Adeptus Astartes[/b] (Space Marines) are a tabletop army in [[Warhammer 40K]]. They are a faction within the Imperium of Man, and consist of genetically modified warrior monks. The Adeptus Astartes is split into many chapters of a thousand marines. Each chapter has their own distinct appearance, and some differ quite a bit in terms of traits and tactics. Space Marines are known for wearing massive [[power armor]], painted in their chapter's colors, and wielding [[bolter]]s.

h4. Founding Chapters
* [[Dark Angels]] - I - led by [[Lion El'Jonson]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - II - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[Emperor's Children]] - III - led by [[Fulgrim]] - Traitor
* [[Iron Warriors]] - IV - led by [[Perturabo]] - Traitor
* [[White Scars]] - V - led by [[Jaghatai Khan]] - Loyalist 
* [[Space Wolves]] - VI - led by [[Leman Russ]] - Loyalist
* [[Imperial Fists]] - VII - led by [[Rogal Dorn]] - Loyalist
* [[Night Lords]] - VIII - led by [[Konrad Curze]] - Traitor
* [[Blood Angels]] - IX  - led by [[Sanguinius]] - Loyalist
* [[Iron Hands (Warhammer)|]] - X - led by [[Ferrus Manus]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - XI - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[World Eaters]] - XII - led by [[Angron]] - Traitor
* [[Ultramarines]] - XIII - led by [[Roboute Guilliman]] - Loyalist
* [[Death Guard]] - XIV- led by [[Mortarion]] - Traitor
* [[Thousand Sons]] - XV - led by [[Magnus the Red]] - Traitor
* [[Black Legion|Luna Wolves/Sons of Horus/Black Legion]] - XVI - led by [[Horus Lupercal]] - Traitor
* [[Word Bearers]] - XVII - led by [[Lorgar Aurelian]] - Traitor 
* [[Salamanders (Warhammer)|]] - XVIII - led by [[Vulkan]] - Loyalist
* [[Raven Guard]] - XIX - led by [[Corvus Corax (warhammer)|]] - Loyalist
* [[Alpha Legion]] - XX - led by [[Alpharius Omegon]] - Traitor

h6. Other Notable Chapters
* [[Black Templars]] - Successor chapter of [[Imperial Fists]]
* [[Blood Ravens]] - Chapter featured in [[Dawn of War]]
* [[Marines Malevolent]]
* [[Red Scorpions]]
* [[Carcharodons]]

h4. See also
* [[Chaos Space Marine]] - Chaos counterpart
* [[Primaris Space Marine]]
